186022538.review:
NieR: Automata é uma obra-prima que combina ação frenética, narrativa profunda e reflexões filosóficas. No papel de androides lutando contra máquinas em um futuro pós-apocalíptico, o jogador é levado por uma história emocionante e cheia de reviravoltas.

Com jogabilidade fluida, trilha sonora memorável e múltiplos finais que incentivam a rejogabilidade, o jogo vai além do entretenimento, oferecendo uma experiência única. Perfeito para quem busca profundidade e inovação, NieR: Automata é indispensável. Outro ponto forte é a forma como NieR: Automata quebra as barreiras tradicionais dos videogames. Ele convida o jogador a refletir sobre questões filosóficas e existenciais, como a natureza da vida, do livre-arbítrio e da busca por significado.

Might be the most overrated game ever, I’d really recommend reading this before getting this game.

the games good great in fact but people treat this like the holy grail of gaming and i just don’t see why, to be fair i’m about half way through ending A and i heard this games 20+ hours long but gameplay wise it’s pretty basic the combat isn’t bad it’s a hack and slash no where near dmc or mgrr levels but when I mean basic like super basic I know the game came out in 2017 but once again people are calling this shit a masterpiece.

the story so far is decent I’ve kind of gotten spoiled which I won’t get into. I’m very into philosophy and people always say this game has good philosophy but it’s just super bare bones with its subjects and it’s pretty predictable about what’s going on in the story the more you play through the game, but it just feels off.. like
the closest thing I can compare it to is to something like a kids movie, it has enough plot to be plot but there’s just not too much going in on it for me 

this next part is one example of why i feel this way so if you don’t want spoilers dont read this part…

in the beginning of the game a boss fight happens in the [spoiler] city ruins [/spoiler] and it’s revealed that an [spoiler] alien mother ship is in the middle of the city [/spoiler] which I thought would be a subnautica or a outer wilds level moment but it was just super jarring and disappointing the whole [spoiler] aliens created the robots thing [/spoiler] is cool but like I said there’s just noting crazy going for it 

Don’t wanna make this too long so here’s some other things I don’t like and like about this game 

 the characters are boring and have super generic tropes 

(their character designs are really saving them) 

the music in this game gets all the praise it deserves 

side quests are super fucking bad usually including boring characters and tasks 
and having to back track just makes it worse because transversing through the “open world” is just horrible in my opinion 

the mini map in this game is just so useless like it cant be that hard to make a video game mini map this is one small thing that just urks me, it’s super fucking confusing going through certain areas and having a shitty map doesn't make it any better 

this game looks great the areas look so good for a game in 2017 this games has very very good art design 

i'm still saying this game is good and I listed way more cons than pros but to be fair that's on my part too. I went into this game with way too much expectation but can you really blame me if everyone calls it a masterpiece? 
games not bad, super overrated and overhyped, not a masterpiece but that word lost its meaning a long time ago. 

hopefully I do end up liking this game more I’ve been deciding if I should get NieR: relipicant because I think I’d find that way more interesting but i’m still trying my best to like this game and push through it

185981988.review:
这款游戏，最初是在2017年发布时就让我眼前一亮，但由于一些原因，我只看了个开头，之后便停了下来。但作为一名忠实的2B迷，她的形象深深烙印在我的心里，尤其是她那冷酷又优雅的姿态，简直让我无法忘怀！

说到游戏的内容，作为一款经典的老游戏，虽然在很多方面都非常出色，但也不能否认存在一些问题。首先，游戏流程相对较短，重复性的内容还是有些多，玩久了会感到有些单调。虽然有不少隐藏彩蛋和秘密等待挖掘，有点重复，毕竟如果一直为了这些东西去跑，可能会感觉有点消耗热情。幸运的是，游戏的音乐部分完全弥补了这些缺点，尤其是《The Weight of the World》那首曲子，简直是神作！每当它响起，配上2B的身姿，我的心情也不禁随着它的旋律飘动，驱使我继续深入探索剧情。

最让我感动的部分，绝对是游戏的E结局。作为一个剧情驱动型游戏，结局本应该是最重要的时刻，然而《尼尔：机械纪元》在结局处理上堪称完美。最特别的地方，就是制作组将通常的制作名单画面转变为一个与制作组对抗的弹幕游戏。当我在无数次失败后，看到来自世界各地的玩家在屏幕上为我挡住敌人的弹幕、牺牲自己的存档来帮我通关时，真的有种无比沉重的责任感。最后，当游戏询问是否删除存档帮助其他玩家时，配上深情的BGM，那一刻真的是心潮澎湃，有一种“壮烈牺牲”的感觉。这种做法非常特别，也让我感到深深的震撼。虽然它在形式上有些出乎意料，但从情感上却异常契合。

作为一款剧情向游戏，大多数玩家可能在通关一次后就不再继续了。但这个结尾——删除存档的决定——不仅是对自己曾经经历的总结，也象征着游戏和玩家之间深深的告别。它带给了我一种情感上的升华，真的很喜欢这个结局的设计。尼尔：机械纪元 不仅是一个动作冒险游戏，它是一次深刻的心灵体验。无论是剧情、角色，还是音乐，甚至是结局的设计，都让人感受到游戏的深度与艺术性。特别是2B，她不仅仅是一个角色，她是这款游戏的灵魂。

185920516.review:
"A Masterpiece."
This is the greatest game I've ever played. An incredible experience. I played it all the way through to the true ending, Ending E. Btw, if this is your first time playing it, don't stop at Ending A or B. The game basically has an entire built-in sequel to unlock with the third playthrough. 

What can I say about this game that so many others haven't said? The story is truly incredible. Unlike most Western RPG's with massive open worlds that are "as broad as an ocean but deep as a puddle", NieR Automata is deep, deep, deep in its storytelling. Basically all the sidequests have stories that directly feed into the main story. So you never feel like you're just wasting your time on something meaningless. The action is buttery-smooth as you can expect from Platform Games which did titles like Bayonetta. And the story, art, and RPG elements are incredible as you would expect for classic Squaresoft JRPG's. This is definitely right up there with Final Fantasy 7 as the greatest JRPG Squaresoft has ever made. The platforming elements are super precise, and the gameplay is just tons of fun to play. But it'll be the story that stays with you long after. Even my roommate who watched me play said "Wow... This game is a Masterpiece..." Once you finish this game you'll be part of the Yoko Taro cult forever... I'm playing NieR Replicant now and enjoying that as well. 

If you have never had the experience to play this game: do yourself a favor and get it. It's worth every penny, and much more so if you get it on sale. 

20/10 would highly recommend.

Одна из тех игр, которая затягивает с первых минут и не отпускает планку до самого конца 
Сюжет - главная фишка этой игры, он буквально шедевральный
Геймплей вполне себе неплох, достаточно много оружий, способностей, чипов
Персонажи - вторая главная фишка этой игры, главные герои, оба прописаны, раскрыты, их чувства и виденье мира развиваются всю игру, от обычных андроидов выполняющих приказы, до полноценных личностей, со своей идеалогией, чувствами и виденьем мира
Да даже антагонисты, а точнее Адам, развивается и демонстрирует свою идеалогию, свои чувства, его слова, о ненависти я вспоминал всю оставшуюся игру, ведь где не посмотри, а его слова подтверждались, это подтверждала и Ева и наши главные герои
Мир достаточно неплох, да, начальные локации достаточно однотипные, да и пустыня буквально пустая, хоть так и должно быть
Так же разработчики знают как удержать игроков в игре, это подтверждается не раз, да взять ту же "новую игру +", в ней, отличается почти все, геймплей, сюжет, миссии и концовка, добавляются новые мобы и возможности, которые раньше нельзя было сделать, игра, даже после первого прохождения чувствуется свежо и не душно, как во всех остальных играх, советую не любому, ведь игра может даже визуально не понравится, но попробовать стоит 
Игра однозначно шедевр, 10/10

185897741.review:
[i][h1]Недооцененное может оказаться дороже всего.[/h1][/i]

[u][b]Пожалуй я ещё никогда так не ошибался в своей жизни, как в случае с NieR:Automata.[/b][/u]

Знакомство с этой игрой у меня началось ещё в 2019 году, благодаря запоминающейся главной героине – [i][b]2B[/b][/i]. Видел множество скриншотов с ней, обсуждений, артов, иллюстраций, но не скажу, что меня что-либо из вышеперечисленного заинтересовало, поэтому данный продукт прошёл мимо меня, а отношение к игре складывалось негативно-нейтральное. Да и когда я всё же решился купить игру за оставшиеся на балансе средства, я посредственно отнёсся к данному произведению, думая, что это крайне переоценённый продукт и стоило купить что-либо более стоящее. В первый час геймплея мне и правда хотелось поскорее закончить, либо вовсе забросить сие чудо, ведь вдобавок к моему негативному мнению, пролог оказался мне не по силам, поэтому я трижды начинал всё с нуля.

Однако, моё мнение кардинально изменилось сразу после пролога и доступа к открытому миру. Сказать, что я был поражён – значит не сказать ничего. Присутствовало ощущение собственной некомпетентности, будто я испытываю чувство вины за то, что не дал даже и шанса этой игре и положил на неё крест ещё на моменте первого знакомства. Думаю, что это связано с излишней сексуализацией главной героини ввиду её откровенного наряда или из-за не самой красивой визуальной составляющей, даже на момент выхода игры, но обо всём чуть дальше.

[b]Огромную благодарность хочу выразить автору саундтреков – [i]Кейити Окабэ.[/i][/b] Он проделал невероятную работу для достижения той атмосферы в игре, которая меня привлекла и удержала. Композиции в данной игре просто находятся на другом уровне, несравнимом ни с чем другим. Неимоверное количество времени, по отношению с прохождением основного сюжета, я потратил просто на прогулки по открытому миру и прослушивание композиций. [u][b]Это правда, очень впечатляюще.[/b][/u]
Похвалы также заслуживает и работа сценаристов. Пускай повествование и не столь объёмное, как у того же [b]Death Stranding[/b] или [b]Cyberpunk 2077[/b], но несмотря на это, оно способно зацепить, причём достаточно сильно. В частности говорю и про побочные задания, которые прекрасно дополняют общую картину взаимоотношений [i][b]2B[/b][/i] и [i][b]9S[/b][/i], людей и андроидов, машин и андроидов. Не могу представить себе отсутствие побочных заданий. Без них не достигается такой привязанности к персонажам, эмпатии к ним. Крайне рекомендую по мере прохождения основного сюжета проходить и побочные квесты.
Озвучка игры тоже оказалась на крайне хорошем уровне. Как любитель японской локализации, я, конечно же, от начала и до конца слушал японские голоса персонажей, и думаю, что каждый должен пройти именно на японском.

Ранее упомянул, что визуальная составляющая игры не является впечатляющей, а скорее даже наоборот, немного разочаровывает. Можно невооружённым глазом заметить дыры на стыках текстур, излишнюю резкость песка и многих других объектов на карте, размытие, портящее внешний вид изображения. Я достаточно придирчиво отношусь к графическим элементам в игре, [b]но это тот самый случай, когда мне даже не хотелось портить оригинальную картинку и убирать ограничение в 60 кадров в секунду.[/b] Могу отметить отсутствие русского интерфейса в игре, но, разумеется, можно скачать неплохой русификатор на просторах интернета, с которым можно понимать большую часть сюжета.

Неспроста я в самом начале выбрал такую цитату. Для меня данное произведение стало одним из лучших в игровой индустрии. Оно повлияло на меня, заставило задуматься о некоторых вещах, что-то переосмыслить. Могу только поаплодировать разработчикам и всем, кто был причастен к созданию этого шедевра. Хотелось бы вернуться во времени назад и пройти игру гораздо раньше, чем я это сделал. [u][b]Лучшее, во что я когда-либо играл.[/b][/u]

[u][b]Это шедевр. Спасибо.[/b][/u]

185895333.review:
6.5/10 - get it on deep sale for a great story (Mixed review really but it's too good to not recommend)

Great setting and story setup that just doesn't work with anime-like kinky/erotic and cute energy. Also the plot took itself more serious that it actually were. It's very typical for JP made games, take a single idea and stretch it out of proportion. Sometimes it works great. Sometimes not so much.
Want a better philosophy on mind, humanity, androids, existance? 
Play SOMA. Play Signalis. Heck, play C2077. Watch Blade Runner movies.

Also gameplay is a mixed bag. It goes from great combos to arcady and very clunky when presented with lots of enemies at the same time.
It's worth A playthrough but once I reached the end I had no desire to replay and get some new perspectives but reached for YT and it was the right call to do so (as I predicted what's going on correctly within the first few hours).

It's like anime with great story points cocked-up with boring fillers and moaning "cute wannabe" characters. Maybe you need to be a teenager to dig it. As a whole it just isn't THERE, on masterpiece level. The port itself is rather rough and not that great even with community fixes. Loved the music. Loved art direction.

185887846.review:
Я був доволі скептично налаштований до гри, бо і геймплейні ролики, і історія про сексапільних андроїдів з пов'язками на очах взагалі не вражали і нагадували мені якийсь посередній фандом. При тому що гру мені навіть подарували, я максимально відкладав її, але якось постійно вона потрапляла в моє поле зору, не в останню чергу через люті рекомендації CyberCrisade'а. І ось пройшовши гру на трушну Е кінцівку я можу сказати тільки одне - нажаль я не може стерти собі пам'ять щоб знову пограти у Nier Automata

Далі тут будуть просто деякі враження, щоб сильно не спойлерити гру, бо це важливо. Та навіть якщо я розкажу сюжет, то все одно шанс зрозуміти про що я взагалі кажу дуже мізерний у непідготовленого читача.

Цю гру важко оцінити, а ще більше рекомендувати, тому що її головна особливість це певний емоційний та ігровий експіренс. Найголовніше тут саме ігровий, бо просто подивитися аніме яке частково переказує певні ігрові епізоди замало, щоб щось зрозуміти чи емоційно прореагувати на події, а просто грати не заглиблюючись в сюжет буде нудно. Тому гру треба сприймати як повноцінний комплексний твір, а це складно, тому у гри доволі багато негативних рецензій які абсолютно правдиві, але люди які їх писали просто поверхнево ознайомились з грою. 

Наприклад, геймплей тут доволі меланхолійний бітемап, без довгих серій комбо, чи великої кількості стилів, але він достатньо челенжевий на останній складності, тому він такий лаконічний, сюжет сварять за плоскість, особливо люди які дійшли тільки до кінцівки А, не підозрюючи, що це десь тільки 1/3 всих подій, і що тут насправді є ще мета сюжет за рамками пригод 2B.

Я отримав велике емоційне задоволення від усієї гри в цілому, не від конкретних механік, чи окремо сюжета, чи окремо персонажа. Чи це крутий ігровий твір - так, чи це гра для всіх - ні, чи цю гру можна коректно оцінити просто перерахувавши механіки - також ні.

Та при всьому цьому я щиро рекомендую спробувати гру, а ще краще пройти її хоча на 80% і ось якщо після цього ви знайдете себе десь на форуму редіта розмірковуючим про [spoiler] проект Гештальт, реплікантів, нульового пацієнта, спогади А2 про дитинство на фермі та долю Еміля [/spoiler] - ви зрозумієте чому це культовий комплексний твір

185832457.review:
打完了abcdew结局，发现如果再重新进入又是序章开始没法选关，大意了。
大部分成就都拿到了，干脆剩下结局不打了。
这个推荐给的是支线内容和配角。

以下是很个人的游玩记录和评价。
如果只算主线，这游戏我只能给5/10，二周目实在是重复太严重了，虽然推进进度快了非常多，但是很烦。
如果把支线算进来，差不多是7.5/10，配角塑造的基本上都比主角好，帕斯卡整体内容做的相当不错。

这个游戏好像我买的时候是2019年左右，然后一周目我从买来开始一直打到2025年……[spoiler] （在此间打完了空洞、脑叶等等等等）[/spoiler]然后从一周目的森林开始一直到e结局打完，大概用了三四周的空闲时间，主要还是再电脑里太占地方了。

忠告：不要主线和支线一块做，否则不知道什么时候就会被主线被刺[spoiler]（一周目快结尾的时候终于带着9s把森林之王的宝藏做完了，结果主线推进到叛军基地出乱子，死活找不到交任务的npc，任务失败。三周目操纵a2从帕斯卡村子接了一堆任务，跑完游乐园孩子们玩的任务之后，想把手里任务都做一下然后回来一块交任务，扭头跑了抵抗军之地顺手做了一把主线，紧接了村子就毁了……任务失败）[/spoiler]，以及三周目面对孔子老子比一周目好打多了。

音乐很好听，但是反复就是那几首歌，特别是游乐园的，听多了就烦了。一周目没搞完多少支线，进工厂忘了补药，打老子孔子夏娃的时候打的想死……不过最后还是打过了，真不容易。二周目比一周目好打的多，特别是对我这种打以撒并晕3D的人。三周目最后频繁换视角太烦了，虽然不难打，但是9s的普通攻击实在是……

不太喜欢一周目结局2b那个服装（疯狂和朋友吐槽），对这个游戏评分随着主线（一二周目）的进行一路下滑简直了，a2感觉就是被卷进来的无辜路人……制作人的心思太明显，导致主线的内容真的挺一般的、

综合各个结局，感觉D结局还算是不错[spoiler]（什么，Adam还真的对eve有感情啊，我看他直接跑去找2b送死还以为他不在乎这个弟弟呢）[/spoiler]，我让9s留下了，顺便吐槽一句攻略，打工厂那个球的阶段还是要攻击，攻略上写的躲就是了……躲了半天还是Game over。以及攻略上说一周目完成通信员找花任务之后三周目会有彩蛋，我还一直向着哪里有……结果……[spoiler]那是彩蛋吗！那是看你伤的不够深回来又插你一刀，和后面12O一样一样的，精准暴击！[/spoiler]顺便一说，打完了感觉这个地图整体来说还是太小了。

最后再夸一句，帕斯卡和司令官这些配角的刻画是真的挺不错的√

185817340.review:
I have given this game two honest tries now and I still can't bring myself to even finish part A. This game is painfully average, maybe a 7 at best. 

I'm a fan of philosophy, so I went into this game expecting an engaging story which touched on concepts of existentialism, the soul, consciousness and religion to at least a decent depth. However, what I got from the amount of gameplay I could stomach was a painfully shallow and heavy handed philosophical discussion which touches on the barebones basics and nothing more. I mean, the game partially gives itself away within the first two hours when you realise Yorha ain't what they say they are and that maybe the machines can in fact show genuine emotions and societal development. It isn't helped by the same general conversation being rehashed every time 2B and 9S come into contact with machines that are exhibiting human emotions and activities. Perhaps for those of us who haven't come across the philosophical themes presented in this game, they would have a much better time with it. 

I also just cant connect with the characters. A rock has more personality than 2B and 9S keeps on over emoting for no good reason. I really just cannot bring myself to care about them beyond how pleasant 2B's English VA sounds and the obvious gooner bait that she presents. 

The gameplay aggravated me no end. It seems intent with wasting your time going from A to B from places you've already explored to another place you've already explored for some irrelevant fetch quest is just awful. Let me fast travel there for goodness sakes. I liked the save mechanic of this game as a positive, as I enjoyed some of the combat set pieces but overall the gameplay was average and ultimately shallow as far as these types of games go. 

I could go on but these are my main gripes with the game. I much prefer the anime adaptation as it is a much more focused experience while still perhaps being a bit shallow and will continue to watch it. I'm happy I at least gave this game a decent shot.

Nier: Automata .. the game which is a treasure. When i bought this game, i didnt expect it will take me so hard into the story. First hour i thought that the gameplay is really retro, not bad at all, but really retro. But then, you start to controll main character, 2B.
The gameplay is simply hack n slash action with open world. Its good balanced and i didnt have any issues on medium difficulty. The open world is not the biggest, but the devs use it to its maximum. 
Graphics ... yeah, its already 8 years old game, but still nice graphic. There are even mods which replace the textures. Worth trying ;)
And now, the story ... Thats why i think this game is the GEM. I will not spoil anything. But i like that the story started simply. Androids are good, robots are bad ... But as you continue to play, you will find that the world of Nier automata is not black n white, but it has a huge scale of grey colors. And if i will add some twitsplots in twistplots in twistplots ... Your mind will evaporate pretty easily.

Nier automata ... great game with great story. Definitely belongs in to my favorite games.

185760016.review:
I had high expectations for this game due to all the positive reviews but I just couldn't get into it. The biggest problem is that combat is too simple and basic. There's no strategy or skill involved. Even though there are several weapons in the game, the weapons are so basic that there's no need to take the time to learn individual weapons. I just used the exact same attack pattern regardless of which weapon I was using. Being an action RPG, shallow combat can be overlooked if the RPG elements are solid. Sadly, even the RPG elements are very plain with most of the upgrades being mere stat boosts that do little to change gameplay. The camera is also too low to the ground so the player character constantly obstructs view. There are also several boss fights where it's too hard to see anything. This game received a lot of praise for its story, but I found the story uninteresting as well. Lastly, there are quite a few minor bugs.

The music is good and the atmosphere is quite artistic. For players who can overlook shallow combat, this game might be worth playing. For players who want a deeper combat system, I recommend looking else where.

6/10

185728184.review:
[h2] 以JRPG的角度来看，无疑是高分作。但以动作游戏的视角来看，实在是有些乏味且过时 [/h2]
打完主要的五个结局来简评下吧。上面这两句话基本就是总结我个人对这个游戏的看法了。先说好的方面，首先是人设做得很好，外形方面无可挑剔的美，我反正是不会拒绝像2B这么好看的女角色。人物性格塑造也很好，随着剧情深入，无论是重要角色还是次要角色，都给我留下了足够深的印象。个人笑得最开心的部分就是A2前期在帕斯卡村的交流，毒舌pod042和傲娇A2的互动，一度让A2的好感度在我心中超过2B，只可惜这段流程太短太短太短！支线中也有一些小故事写的也不错，就不一一说了。其次剧情部分我觉得也挺好的，其实剧情走向在看了这么多年日式动漫都能猜个7788，但结尾pod的意识觉醒还是让我很感动。最后最神的地方还得是音乐部分，我标题为什么说作为jrpg来看这个游戏很好，就是代入感强，能让玩家充分感受到游戏中人物的思想，这里起到关键作用的就是本作的bgm。每个地区的音乐都有自己的特色。制作名单的weight of the world更是神中神。三次过制作名单没有丝毫想要跳过的想法。歌词也是非常贴合本作剧情。总之配乐方面无疑是上乘。
说完好的，那么接下来就是难熬的地方。这个游戏一周目前五章花了我几个月吧，后续剧情起来后三天就打完了。前期是真没兴趣打开。先说动作方面，这个我想起来就好笑，我本身就是重度的动作游戏爱好者，还真就是被动作游戏的名号吸引过来玩的。你要说2b本身，动作模组也蛮多的，武器也有30多个嘛，但没有太多按键组合，基本就是AAAAA就完事了，武器升级也仅仅就是多摁一下多一个动作收尾，但这其实不算差。真正差的是本作的敌方阵营，只能说让我根本没有砍的欲望。打击感什么的我是觉得很烂，而且敌方阵营就是机械生物，拳拳到肉啥的就不说了，就不存在肉（笑。或许路边的鹿和野猪可以算）。交互什么的也很垃，boss基本是你打你的我打我的。点名那个天上飞的虫，若只的一B，控制9s打虫的话我必骇入，砍上去没有任何反馈，伤害判定也是迷。[spoiler] 更好笑的是帕斯卡村出事那，A2进去视角是固定的，要在一个固定视角打两只飞来飞去的虫，直接折磨翻倍 [/spoiler]。动作部分简单总结就是，本身人物的动作模组设计一般般，算及格，但小怪boss设计太过拉胯，战斗体验大部分时间都很垃圾，也就后期有超频芯片后，去竞技场打一打才稍微有那么一点动作游戏的快感。然后是本作全程充斥着各种场景的打飞机，我是觉得很无聊，这个可以说见仁见智，反正我是觉得很过时。还有就是9s的骇入小游戏，这个我觉得跟打飞机的游戏是一样的，无趣。最后那个老子孔子战就是9s不停的打飞机，a2不停的打木桩，简直是又臭又长，差点把我打睡着了。最后e结局，[spoiler] 片尾打飞机对抗整个制作名单，我明白制作组的用意，也觉得确实挺有创意，也挺感人，耳边回响着本作我最爱的曲子，我心里也不停的暗示这里很感人啊，但我为什么就是觉得无聊呢？事实就是这个小游戏就是很无聊，不如安安静静听歌 [/spoiler]所以我认为，单从动作系统上来说，本作带给我的除了无聊就是无聊，通马桶式的小游戏也太多，影响正常的游戏体验。和同期的贝姐相比，动作深度啥的属实是被爆杀，但一样是深受小游戏的迫害。能不能别在动作游戏里塞些奇奇怪怪的玩意啊。再说跑图，前期没有传送的情况也是比较折磨，支线任务也是以跑腿为主，没什么意思。
最后，总结就是标题了。说实话在游戏过程中，我保持要给这游戏打差评的想法绝对是占大多数时间的，因为我个人对动作游戏的要求比较高，大概就是吃细糠吃太多导致的。但玩到最后，剧情音乐的分量终究是战胜了本身的游戏体验。不过有一点还是得说，虽然我这里评价是推荐，如果朋友问我要不要玩这游戏，我肯定会给否定答案，不如直接云来得好。

185720563.review:
Finding words for this experience is quite difficult. You don't just play a game, you expierence a story leaving you feeling empty inside, questioning yourself, what is our puprpose, is everything meaningless? I've feared to make any personal connections with any character, knowing, it's not going to last, nothing will.

After clearing my thoughts, I want to talk about the gameplay. I liked the combat very much. Very satisfying but could have gone further, cause at some point it starts to feel a bit repetitive. I liked exploring the world with the fun platforming mechanics. Sadly the world isn't that big and you often run forth and back through the same locations during your playtime. Really wished there was more to explore and utilize your abilities. The second half of the game is clearly putting more emphasis into the story, which I really really liked, but I wanted to see more new gameplay 

Spoiler: 
This is also a problem with Route B, where you must play the first half of the game again with 9S. Really liked the expanded lore and reveals here, but playing the game all over again was a bit off a downer for me, even with the different combat system, putting emphasis on hacking. On the other hand, multiple playthroughs put more depth into the story revaeling new layers to it.

Despite all criticism, I really treasure my time with this game. This isn't just a game, this is not just a piece of art, this is an unparalelled experience. Please play it.

185713326.review: 横尾太郎の暗黑小故事合集。游戏性让渡于演出的特点无疑是横尾个性的最好展现，横板、俯视、推箱子、弹幕游戏，各种各样的形式完全为了游戏的风格服务，自成一体而不显得突兀；自动芯片、贩卖成就更显示相较“游戏”部分的乐趣，本作更注重于文本对玩家的吸引力，即引导玩家尽可能完整过一遍剧情为要务。然而C、D结局潦草收尾，E结局的转进生硬更像是突然有了点子再回头快马加编。吉田的人设潮得挑不出毛病（2b），几首bgm展示了音画搭配的上限（pascal、memories of dust、vague hope、Alien Manifestation），承载这些要素大部分展示时间的支线任务却烂成依托，刨去空荡荡的沙漠尼尔的地图相当小，支线任务只能来回在几个区域间设定目标，工厂废墟这种粪图居然三番五次要求玩家跑一遍，简直让人作呕（剧情还可以的支线：礼物、流浪的情侣、帕斯卡村庄相关、照看动物）。除此之外，尽管本作花了诸多心思在剧情的打磨之上，横尾的创作范式却天然带来了瓶颈，以机械的身份陌生化人类的行为，再对此加以讽刺，但如此既定的答案玩家几个支线后便可抢答。另外一些“黑暗”故事更是不值一提纯粹凑数。故事的基点本身架设在无意义的命题之上，y线借emil之言尚且算是尝试解答，e结局只能求助于屏幕外的玩家，以一种唯心的方式完成和解，对游戏内的角色和牺牲无疑是一种亵渎，相比之下断于中途的a结局更胜一筹。（掐脖子和复制体，有一股eva味）

185668061.review:
One of the most poignant games I've played, ever. It tells a coherent story while effortlessly tying themes of humanity, isolation, optimistic nihilism into a narrative that while somewhat meek at first slowly starts gripping you into it's world, it's weird, it's funny sometimes, it's heart-wrenching and most of all, the narrative is a masterpiece, I started the game thinking it was just another overrated button masher games with supposedly good story to it, at the time I didn't know the genius of it's storytelling, so it almost feels insulting to call it that now, but hey, I've corrected my mistake and played it through to the end, I've also said yes to one of the hardest last choices in the game, those who have played may know what happens, but I am not going to spoil it here, hopefully that decision helps someone somewhere...
Now about combat, it's flashy, it's really, REALLY fast paced, and most importantly fun, it may not have as much depth as say, DMC series's combat systems(excluding DMC2), but it is definitely fun, the chip slot/upgrade system is great and you can create distinct loadouts for each combat situation or just for the sake of experimentation, it is all up to you.
In conclusion, if you can play this game, even though you may not like these kind of games, give it a shot, your perspective will definitely change, 9.5/10 for me which is a masterpiece in my book.

185659623.review:
Decent enough game, overrated though.
I think the less exposure you've had to this type of scifi, the more you will enjoy the story of Nier Automata.

The good:
- The plot and the overall atmosphere are solid. The OST is absolutely fantastic.
- Female androids are easy on the eyes.

The meh: 
- The story and characters lack any depth, nuance or subtlety. Almost everything and everyone is one dimensional, there to serve only a single purpose in the story, there is no subtlety nor nuance.
- The main theme of what it means to be a being with consciousness is addressed only at a surface level.
- Side quest design feels like it's straight out of an mmo.
- The combat is mindlessly easy on normal (intended) difficulty. 

Overall, a 6-7/10.

Uma obra de arte.

O jogo é tão a frente do seu tempo que eu fiquei maravilhado com cada parte e cada capítulo dessa história. Não há comentários que existam sem acabar com uma parte da experiência. Gráficos, trilha sonora, ambientação, direção de arte, e todo o resto são fenomenais e eu não me arrependo em nenhum momento de jogar essa maravilha.

Se você ainda não se decidiu, jogue, é um conflito filosófico do começo ao fim, mas não se deixe iludir pelos múltiplos finais do jogo, assim que terminar pela primeira vez, busque os outros, a denominação de finais do jogo são de "A" até "Z", mas o final "A" - o primeiro que você obtém - não é sequer o final da história principal, carregue seu arquivo salvo mais uma vez e experiencie, até o final, tudo que esse jogo pode demonstrar.

YOKO TARO, muito obrigado por essa experiência sem igual que eu jamais vou deixar de elogiar, e para alguém que leia isso, esteja preparado pra possivelmente um dos melhores jogos já feitos.

10/10.

[h1] NieR:Automata [/h1]
Игра тронувшая сердца сотни тысяч игроков после своего выхода, которая продолжает делать это, и по сегодняшний день.  Удивившая своим сюжетом, миром, персонажами, музыкой, и необычайной атмосферой.
[b] Творение [/b] [i] Ёко Таро [/i], которое назвать просто игрой тяжело.
Это чудо, которое я открыл для себя в это не лёгкое время, в вселенную которого я погрузился с головой, и не пожалел.

[h2] Каждому [/h2] человеку который задумается о покупке данной игры, я не только очень посоветую её купить и в следствии пройти. А дам пару очень важных советов, которые поможет получить 
максимальное удовольствие от игры и её сюжета.
Если вы только задумываетесь о прохождении автоматы, то [b] НИ В КОЕМ СЛУЧАЕ [/b] не смотрите обзоры в которых имеются даже малейшие спойлеры по сюжету.
Если вы уже начали прохождение, то после получения первой концовки, игра порекомендует загрузить сохранение, 
в данном моменте стоит послушать игру, сделав это. [spoiler] (и чуть позже, сделать это ещё раз) [/spoiler]

В игре всего 5 основных концовок. Которые для полной картины происходящего, и получения 
самых разных ощущений вы должны получить, что сделать крайне просто.

Геймплей в автомате интересен но может приестся к концу игры, боёвка сделана на высоком уровне и ощущается приятно.
Побочные квесты интересны и разнообразны, истории рассказываемые интересны, хотя и время от времени
могут показаться немного странными, а открытый мир интересен к изучению.
Саундтрэк в игре прекрасен, и заставляет меня вспоминать моменты радости и грусти, которые произошли с нашими героями.
Сложность в игре настраиваемая, на среднем уровне сложности игра не заставляет игрока потеть, и является хорошим
слэшэром, который иногда может испытывать твои навыки. [spoiler] количество аптечек [/spoiler]

В итоге, NieR:Automata это прекрасная игра, редкий алмаз, и одна из тех единиц, которая заставила меня пустить скупую слезу.
Автомата заняла отдельное место в моей душе и моём сердце, согревая их обоих.

В игре есть минусы, но для меня они не существенны и затмеваются плюсами. 
Буду рад если напишете своё мнение.

[h1] 9.9/10 [/h1] [spoiler] (Не 10 так как у меня уже есть любимая игра) [/spoiler]

[spoiler] В итоге этот обзор стал местом куда я вылил все свои эмоции которые накопились после прохождения, ну и ладно. [/spoiler]

185589888.review:
[h2]Philosophical Robots and a Million Endings – A One-of-a-Kind Experience[/h2]
Think you’re just playing a sci-fi action RPG? Think again. NieR:Automata is like an interactive art film where you constantly ask yourself, “Am I here to fight, or to rethink my life choices?” It mixes deep philosophical questions with explosive boss battles and a staggering 26 (!) endings.

[h3]Story[/h3]
You play as androids in a post-apocalyptic world ruled by machines. Your mission? Save humanity—or what’s left of it, anyway. But before you know it, you’re caught up in a story so complex and emotional, you start wondering if robots might just be better at being human than we are. It sounds simple, but within five minutes, the game has thrown all your expectations out the window.

[h3]Gameplay[/h3]
This game is a genre chameleon, seamlessly switching between hack-and-slash, shoot-’em-up, and “What the heck just happened?” moments. The controls are buttery smooth, and 2B’s combat moves are so fluid you’ll feel like a futuristic samurai. But be careful: Don’t accidentally press the self-destruct button—or do, if you’re curious.

[h3]Strengths[/h3]
[b]✔️ Combat That’s Addictive[/b]
From elegant sword combos to laser-blasting Pod attacks, the combat is so stylish you’ll wish it were an eSports event.

[b]✔️ A Story That Blows Your Mind[/b]
Nier:Automata makes you question existence, morality, and what it means to be human—all while battling a robot wearing boxing gloves.

[b]✔️ A Soundtrack for the Ages[/b]
The music is so good you’ll want to play it during your next dinner party. “Weight of the World” will haunt you forever—in the best way possible.

[b]✔️ 2B and Her Iconic Coolness[/b]
Let’s be honest: You’re not just here for the story. 2B is so cool, you’ll consider buying a katana just to feel half as awesome.

[b]✔️ Endings Galore[/b]
This game has 26 endings. Some are emotional, some are funny, and a few happen because you did something absurdly stupid. It’s a joy discovering them all.

[h3]Weaknesses[/h3]
[b]❌ Perspective Switch Chaos[/b]
The game jumps between top-down, side-scrolling, and 3D combat. It’s cool, but sometimes you’ll wonder which genre you’re actually playing.

[b]❌ Emotional Devastation Guaranteed[/b]
You’ll grow attached to robots you never thought you’d care about—and then the game will remind you this is a Yoko Taro creation, where nobody gets a happy ending.

[b]❌ Chaos on Screen[/b]
Sometimes there’s so much happening, you’ll forget where you even are. But hey, maybe that’s part of the charm?

[h3]Achievements[/h3]
The achievements are like your to-do list: varied, occasionally absurd, but incredibly satisfying to complete. And yes, you can buy them in-game—but don’t. Your pride will thank you.

[h3]Target Audience[/h3]
[b]✔️ Recommended for[/b]
• Fans of action RPGs who want more than just mindless combat
• Players who enjoy pondering life’s big questions while battling giant bosses
• People who love epic soundtracks and even more epic swords

[b]❌ Not Recommended for[/b]
• Gamers who want linear stories without twists
• People who don’t want to hunt for multiple endings
• Those who prefer robots to stay emotionless (seriously, who even are you?)

[h3]Final Verdict[/h3]
Nier:Automata isn’t just a game—it’s an experience. It’ll make you think, cry, and marvel, often all at once. With its unique story, phenomenal gameplay, and a soundtrack that will stay with you forever, it’s a must-have. Get ready for philosophical insights and a little emotional damage—it’s worth it. 🤖✨

[b]Note:[/b] My playtime is as distorted as the game’s camera angles. For a realistic estimate, check [url=https://howlongtobeat.com]HowLongToBeat[/url].

185530429.review:
这也许是我所经历过的最伟大的游戏瞬间。看到这则评论时，我脑海里闪过的第一句话便是Andrew Ryan那著名的“A man chooses, a slave obeys”。

一般游戏的名场景大多与电影化叙事一脉相承，互动元素多半只是陪衬（比如QTE）。而尼尔提供的两难选择（清除记忆或者杀死帕斯卡）已经具备了足够的戏剧张力——让玩家感受到不可逃避的悲剧感。在此之上隐含的第三选择更是一种专属于游戏的叙诡：瞬间消解了理想破灭的沉重，转而展现出面对苦难的不屈意志；再回想一下机械生命体、安卓机器人与人类的背景故事，不由感叹这样的情节设计真是妙极。互动叙事的魅力就在于此——玩家不再只是伟大故事的见证者；通过有意义的选择，玩家为故事赋予了更深的内涵，而这反过来也映衬出玩家的伟大，人性的赞歌。

185521562.review:
[h3] 写给新入坑的玩家们的一些关于支线任务的建议： [/h3]

首先，这游戏有主线任务和支线任务。但是，当你推进完一段主线剧情后，你很可能会发现：在推进这一段主线剧情之前的一些支线任务做不了了！
不过不用担心，随着游戏进程的推进，你会解锁一个“选章节”的功能，你可以通过这一功能回到某一段主线，这样你就能做完那些你错过的支线任务。

但是，或许有一部分玩家会和我一样抱有这样的想法：头一天写完作业和第二天补作业的感觉能一样吗？？？
对于我来说，主线剧情结束了就是结束了，我是不会专门为了完成支线而回溯到之前的章节的，因为那给了我一种补作业的感觉。如果说是回到之前的章节去拿一些材料、物资等等我可以接受，但是回到过去做任务，对我来说就像是在看别人的记忆一样。那是别人书写的故事，而并不是我的故事，我的故事已经随着主线剧情的结束而定型了。

在我打到三周目时，我发现二周目没能完成的名为“埃米尔的回忆”的支线任务在三周目无法完成，在查阅了一些和这个任务相关的资料后，我才意识到我承受了一个巨大的损失。通过选章节当然可以回去把任务做完，但是还是那句话：对于我来说，那不是我的故事。

因此，对那些和我一样有这样的癖好的玩家我想说：
在做完现有的支线任务之前，千万不要推进主线！！！因为你很可能在推进主线之后，发现这一段主线之前的一些支线任务你做不了了！！！所以，如果你想要推进主线，一定要确保你的支线任务全部完成！全部完成！全部完成！而且一定要小心可能会触发主线剧情的地方，说不定你在做支线任务的时候走到了某个位置，就自动触发主线了！说不定你所触发的主线就是这一周目的最后一个主线任务，而你则会因为无法中断正在推进的主线任务而强制结束了这一周目（我的“埃米尔的回忆”就是这样在二周目错过的，三周目在了解了情况之后直接破防，最终决定把玩了43h的存档删了重新打）！！！

185494824.review:
ЭТА ИГРА ТОТАЛЬНЫЙ ****
ЗА ЭТИ 65 ЧАСОВ ИГРЫ Я ПРОСТО ВПАЛ В ШОК РАЗ ДЕСЯТЬ,ЕСЛИ НЕ СТО...

Игра с сюжетом ого-го...Подан он афигенно!! За исключением наверное того, что я сначала не понял, а потом как понял. Квесты хорошие, рассказывают тоже свой лор - Воспоминания/Решимость Эмиля, квест с прошлым Анемонэ и даже квест с починкой Энгельса был неплох.
Геймплей один из крутых по моему мнению.Играется классно, куча различных механик. В игру не было скучно играть, хотя из-за пары ачивок мне хотелось удалить игру и забыть как страшный сон, но оно того стоило. 
Наверное, единственным минусом(да и не большим минусом) я бы назвал прокачку. Меня немного позабавила идея разработчиков сделать последний квест с требованием - получить и прокачать всё оружие до максимума ради открытия квеста. Но сама прокачка нервирует иногда тем, что чтобы пройти все квесты, тебе надо найти всё оружие, а это заставляет проходить все квесты, искать сундуки, искать ресурсы для оружия и подов(дронов, которые всю игру за вами летают). С уровнем не сильно можно париться, он здесь вроде и нужен, но как бы не ощущается сильного импакта от него, как к примеру от чипов. ЧИПЫ это вообще шедевральная идея, дать в этой игре возможность настройку прокачки персонажа это ГЕНИАЛЬНО.

За эти 65 часов игры, я доволен, что потратил 65 часов на такой классный проект, как Nier:Automata.

어차피 이 게임은 평가 보고 살 사람은 거의 없을테고 단점만 얘기하자면 레벨 디자인이 좆같고 튜토리얼이 없어서 게임 플레이 측면에서는 굉장히 불편하고 불만족스럽다는 것. 아예 다크소울처럼 컨셉잡고 맨땅에 헤딩 존나 해봐 ^^면 얘는 원래 그런 게임이니까 ㅇㅇ 하면서 할텐데 이 게임은 난이도가 소울류처럼 한결같이 높은 게임도 아니면서 갑자기 20렙 차이나는 몹 몇 마리를 보스급으로 떨구고 진행해봐라, 레이저에 탄막 갈기는 보스몹들 여러 기 배치시켜놓고 이거 근접 강화인데 한번 써봐라 심지어 강화도 헤딩인데 강화만 한다고 뭐가 되지는 않고 또 이거 저거 눌러보면서 아 얘가 이런거구나 직접 알아야 함 걍 철권 느낌임
이걸 알아가는 재미라고 포장하면 포장할 수 있겠지만 본인같은 경우 그냥 불쾌함 요즘 세상에 시벌 튜토를 게임 퀘스트 하나하나씩에 잘 녹여내는 게임이 얼마나 많은데 계속 박으면서 이 게임을 알아가도록해 식의 불편함이 연출이나 배경의 장점을 깎아먹는 느낌 ㅇㅇ

185442141.review:
Nier: Automata – A Masterpiece That Transcends Time

(Text partially created with AI, provided what I wanted to be writte about.)

I recently played Nier: Automata towards the end of 2024, and I was absolutely blown away by it. Despite being released in 2017, the game feels incredibly fresh and engaging, showcasing timeless design and storytelling.

First and foremost, the gameplay is a seamless blend of fast-paced action and strategic depth. The fluid combat system kept me hooked, with smooth and responsive controls that made each encounter satisfying. What really stood out to me was how the game constantly reinvented itself through different gameplay modes, whether it was switching from third-person action to top-down shooter segments or platforming sequences. This variety kept the experience consistently exciting, never allowing it to feel repetitive.

But what truly elevates Nier: Automata is its story. It’s not just a typical post-apocalyptic tale; it’s a philosophical exploration of existence, purpose, and the nature of consciousness. The plot twists and the way the narrative unfolds across multiple playthroughs added layers of depth that made me reflect on the game long after I finished it. The characters, particularly 2B, 9S, and A2, are complex and well-written, each contributing to the overall emotional resonance of the story.

In conclusion, Nier: Automata is more than just a game; it’s an experience. The innovative gameplay and profound storytelling made it one of the best gaming experiences I’ve had in recent memory. If you haven’t played it yet, do yourself a favor and dive into this unforgettable journey.

185401290.review:
与其说尼尔是一款游戏，不如说她是一部电影，是一部辉煌的的史诗。至于，我为什么要用“她”，大抵是尼尔带给我的细腻、刺激、沉浸的游戏体验，以及在一、二、三周目结束后对2B、9S、A2的不舍等感情及感觉。史诗的配乐、极美的风景、细致诙谐的对话，以及跌宕起伏的剧情，很难让我相信这是一款8年前的游戏。这也是我唯一一个在游戏剧情结束后想要全成就的游戏。刚开始有些成就很好完成，但接着，难度逐渐加大，我开始产生了放弃的念头，在硬着头皮打了一天后，我突然明白了：全成就不仅是对尼尔的热爱，更是对制作团队的敬意。为了完成成就，不惜苦练跳高、跳远，“不情愿”的当一次“绅士”，不停地刷怪。在一次次跑图、刷怪中，听到“机械生命体”仍会兴奋，看到“地堡”陨落仍会心痛，得知“寄叶”的真相仍会无奈。在看到2B的死仍会伤心，再体会一遍9S的绝望，再让A2奉献一下自我。我想，这就是尼尔，这就是无数人愿意捐掉自己五、六十小时，甚至上百小时的存档而换来一次为陌生人挡子弹的机会的尼尔。我刚开始是不愿去捐掉存档的，可后来突然觉得：存档无非就是一串数据，即使我们保留它，它也是成为世界上众多被遗忘的数据中的一个，如果捐存档能让这串数据变得有意义一些，那我也愿意去成为帮助陌生人的千万个陌生人之一。我想这就是尼尔。
愿人类，荣光永存！

185347800.review:
NieR: Automata is nothing short of a masterpiece. This game, developed by PlatinumGames and directed by the visionary Yoko Taro, is an unforgettable blend of deep storytelling, breathtaking visuals, and exhilarating gameplay.

Narrative Brilliance
The story of NieR: Automata is one of its strongest aspects. Set in a post-apocalyptic world where androids battle alien machines, the narrative explores profound themes like existentialism, the nature of humanity, and the search for purpose. The game masterfully weaves these ideas into its multiple playthroughs, each revealing new layers of the story. By the time you reach Ending E, you'll be left in awe of its emotional depth and innovative storytelling.

Gameplay Excellence
The gameplay is a seamless fusion of hack-and-slash combat and RPG elements. PlatinumGames’ expertise shines through in the fluid and satisfying combat mechanics. Whether you're controlling 2B's elegant swordplay or 9S’s hacking abilities, every moment feels engaging. The variety in gameplay—from bullet-hell sections to side-scrolling segments—ensures it never becomes monotonous.

Visuals and Soundtrack
The aesthetic design of NieR: Automata is stunning. The world is hauntingly beautiful, with desolate ruins, sprawling deserts, and eerie forests creating a sense of melancholy. The character designs are iconic, particularly 2B, whose blend of elegance and strength has made her one of gaming's most beloved characters.

Adding to the experience is the game's extraordinary soundtrack by Keiichi Okabe. Each track perfectly captures the tone of the moment, from heart-pounding combat themes to hauntingly emotional pieces like “Weight of the World.”

Replay Value
With multiple endings, hidden secrets, and thought-provoking decisions, NieR: Automata encourages replayability. Each playthrough brings new perspectives and story elements, making it more than just a repetitive experience.

Verdict
NieR: Automata is a rare gem that transcends the boundaries of what a video game can achieve. Its compelling narrative, superb gameplay, and unforgettable music create a deeply emotional and thought-provoking experience. It’s a must-play for anyone who values storytelling in games or wants to explore a work of art that stays with you long after the credits roll.

🌟 Rating: 10/10
This isn’t just a game—it’s an experience.

185292860.review:
*Minha sincera análise desse jogo F#daaaa S2
1. História profunda e emocionante: Explora temas como existencialismo, identidade, amor e sacrifício.
2. Mecânica de jogabilidade variada: Combina ação, RPG, com uma variedade de armas e habilidades.
3. Mundo pós-apocalíptico fascinante: Ambiente rico, detalhado e atmosférico.
4. Personagens complexos e carismáticos: 2B, 9S e A2 têm histórias e personalidades únicas.
5. Trilha sonora impressionante: Compostas por Keiichi Okabe, Monaca e outros, com músicas emocionantes e memoráveis.
6. Gráficos e animações: Detalhes impressionantes, especialmente nos personagens.

# Pontos Negativos
1. Dificuldade desafiadora: Algumas partes podem ser frustrantes para jogadores inexperientes.
2. Cameras problemáticas: Em alguns momentos, a câmera pode causar confusão.
3. Repetição em algumas missões: Algumas tarefas secundárias podem se sentir repetitivas.
Nota 8,5/10

185189545.review:
Rapaz infelizmente esse foi o primeiro drop de 2025, e espero que seja o único. Teve algo no game que não conseguiu me segurar por mais tempo para poder deslumbrar com sua história e entender o que se passa nesse mundo que nos é apresentado. O combate é o famoso hack'n slash não há o que reclamar disso, os inimigos de modo geral parecem uma esponja já na dificuldade normal, nas mais dificéis é necessário ter muito saco e paciência pra poder jogar visto que a punicão recebida no HP é absurdamente grande sem necessidade o que torna a dificuldade do jogo nenhum pouco elaborada e bem simples -> quanto mais difícil mais dano recebe e mais HP os inimigos tem e é apenas isso não muda nada além disso. 
A história é intrigante, mas infelizmente no momento atual ela não conseguiu me prender ao jogo. O jogo tem um sistema de save é "velho", existe uma mecânica de souls like meio mascarada inserida que pode te frustrar bastante a ponto de acabar com tua build por um momento ou te fazer gastar rios de dinheiro para retornar ao patamar que estava, mas isso só vai ser percebido a medida que for jogando. Para os amantes de hack'n slash o jogo é bem responsivo, os combos são bonitos, malabarísticos (essa palavra existe? xD), esquiva perfeita quando feita é algo incrível. As sidequests também não foram nenhum pouco divertidas ou interessantes até onde eu joguei nessas 14 quase 15 horas de jogo, na realidade elas parecem e foram até o momento 100% aleatórias com recompensas "dispensáveis" só o gold era realmente interessante, mas o maior problema é o tempo que elas tomam e um vai volta em áreas iniciais que te tomam um tempo absurdo. 
Eu não considero NIER um jogo ruim e sim, eu recomendo ele, mas com essas ressalvas elencadas acima. Espero um dia retornar para finalizar minha jornada no game.

Plus sérieusement, NieR: Automata est l'un des jeux qui m'a procuré le plus de sensation, le plus d'émotion jusqu'à maintenant. Cette question persistante ce qui peut définir une humanité, cette question de qu'est ce qu'être humain. 

Vous couplez un texte magnifique écrit, avec des voix débordantes d'émotion. Le tout harmonisé par des musiques qui vous prenne le coeur pour le serrer contre le leur. 

Ce jeu est d'un point de vue scénaristique plus qu'excellent, j'ai pas mal de fois eu de la compassion, de la peine mais surtout l'envie de pleurer. 

Merci pour ce jeu, 
Un androïde perdu dans ce monde

Even though this was not my cup of tea, it would be hard for me not to admit that this game isn't bursting with originality. The reason it doesn't gel with me is the weird story, setting, characters and overall bleak atmosphere. But that weird bleakness will be a draw for a lot of people. What can't be ignored is that the shoot em up/hack n slash gameplay that's coupled with some solid level design, makes for an overall fun time.

Even though it's not my thing, this very much is going to appeal to the anime or alternative sci-fi crowd out there. For those that love some arcade shooter type games and looking for something different, $47.50AUD is a bit steep. However, it is on sale a lot and worth a crack for sure.

185051731.review:
NieR:Automata

Al día de hoy ya deberías saber que este juego es una obra de arte. Hay varias cosas que lo hacen único. Me encantó cada parte de este juego; la banda sonora es espectacular. Me fascinó cómo cambia el tono, la intensidad y el sentimiento de la música dependiendo del escenario. De la misma forma, a nivel artístico, me encantó su paleta de colores: no son agresivos a la vista y son cálidos.

La jugabilidad no es nada repetitiva. Cada tipo de arma tiene características, movimientos y aspectos diferentes, lo que hace que sea una completa gozada probar cada una de ellas.

La historia me encantó, me puso a pensar demasiado. Si tienes el tiempo y la dedicación de leer cada documento del juego, no te vas a arrepentir. Cada documento tiene algo que aportar. Te va a encantar cómo todo se redacta de una manera única. Además, si profundizas en la historia y en cada uno de sus finales, puedo decir que quedé fascinado. El cambio de perspectivas al jugar con 2B, 9S y A2 es notable: cómo cambia la historia y te da la sensación de que cada uno de los personajes tiene sentimientos diferentes, haciéndote empatizar con ellos. Puedo decir que es una historia triste, pero que vale mucho la pena.

Por supuesto, hay cosas que le hicieron falta o que a mí me hubiera gustado que añadieran:

- Más historia: No es una historia corta, pero te deja con un hueco y una tristeza que no se puede explicar.
- Más atuendos: Cada personaje tiene dos aspectos: el predeterminado y el que obtienes al completar los coliseos.
- Más enemigos: Siento que le hizo falta más desafíos.

A pesar de esto, disfruté muchísimo el juego y espero poder jugar más títulos de esta saga. Espero que haya más en un futuro. Este juego vale totalmente la pena, con o sin descuento.

184993013.review:
[h2]【打昏头的一些碎碎念】[/h2]

[u]*剧透杂谈 [/u]
[u]*吐槽为主 [/u]

学习版三周目E结局初体验剧情，入正之后又三周目＆全成就
因此聊聊约5年后的再体验，总体感觉还是坐牢居多吧qwq

[h3]【主剧情＆支线】[/h3]
主剧情就没啥好说的了，
当年E结局哭的有多惨，现在就有多平淡
越看越觉得，9S只是纯粹的拿A2泄愤而已，就好像那个无能狂怒
再通之后留下的感慨就是：果然初体验才够震撼，多周目就纯粹是麻木了

之后这次入正主要的体验内容就是清支线了
不得不感慨部分支线做的还是挺好的，月之泪支线，埃米尔过去的战争历史
支线同样也是为了人设更加饱满而服务的，反正月之泪支线...
我是第一次听到9s这么直球的说想赴死

还有一些比较扭曲的，比如什么11B的遗物啦（前辈似了笑嘻了说好似之类的），记忆丧失啊（姐们当间谍的，天天杀朋友杀的精神都不正常了）
编剧诗人握持，太扭了，支线还在黑深残还在黑深残

还有更折磨人的，比如沙之遗产
本来沙漠就空，不照着视频找能找一年，您就找去吧，100h了您都找不到

[h3]【收集体验＆其他成就】[/h3]
承接上面的沙之遗产，真是要了老命了
由此可看出尼尔有些地方是真的挺让人红温，尤其是那个确认框，得等几秒才能确认
那我缺的跑图这块时间谁给我补呀

以及有些档案、武器是藏在工场废墟里的，这就使得您不得不往那来回跑
本身那地方就黑，压抑，主打一个红黑色调，伸手不见五指。还天天搁那跑，跑就算了，每次都得从工场入口重新开始
就算中间就俩传送点，也作用不大...
因为很多地方长的是[b]一模一样[/b]，走着走着，晕了
那有啥好说的，这辈子不想来这鬼地方了

除此之外，其他档案收集还行，都算是放在比较阳间的地方（正常的草丛里啊）
成就有些也是纯粹的堆时间，比如骑动物骑五公里，黑100个机械生命体等
比较特殊的就9s穿裤衩走一小时这个，这个其实也不难，去沙漠，9s自爆，然后开始找沙之遗产
找一圈回来就有成就了）

[h3]【一些个人评价】[/h3]
E结局我大概用了20+h，之后补全成就就直接用了30+h，可见跑图的垃圾时间有多少
尼尔作为16年的老游戏，二次元RPG属性还是偏重一些，去掉剧情的滤镜，您会发现这游戏其实是一个很繁琐的游戏
比如这个二周目本身就是繁琐的代名词，像我这种走两遍剧情流程的
这个Eve boss剧情我就看了四遍，我都会背了，打个游戏我感觉我像在上班

您要说去掉剧情，还能玩下去的理由..再去掉RPG这个属性，那不只剩下二次元了
[spoiler] 倘若没有2B小姐裙下若隐若现的臀肉我都玩不下去喵，真的 [/spoiler]
SE这byd是知道玩家最想要看什么的

[b] 综评：7/10 [/b]

PS：这游戏连繁中都没有！我用的是天邈汉化包，之前学习版用的3dm汉化，也还差强人意叭
三周目有成就商人，可以直接买成就，如果没有手打成就的执念可以直接买
（没错，我就是那个手打成就的固执b qwq）

184964985.review:
I would need to write a whole essay to describe somewhat accurately all of the unique things that this game does on a gameplay, narrative and conceptual level, and even that would probably still not be enough. If there were such a thing as a "Video Game Hall of Fame," this game would be right there as one of the most significant ones ever made, with arguably some of the biggest cultural impact after its release. That said, it does take a particular kind of gamer who is highly familiar with games in general, and has both the patience and willingness to look beneath the surface and appreciate Automata as more than just the stylish and visually gratifying hack-and-slash that it appears to be at a glance.
Rest assured, if action is what you came for, you'll get it, and there is a lot of it! However, if you are also willing to take your time, read between the lines and follow along with what the game does and doesn't tell you, you'll find not just a tale, but a whole odyssey about what it means to be human, the purpose of life, death and existence itself, wrapped in some of the singular greatest soundtrack ever made. Seriously, just look up tracks like Bipolar Nightmare, A Beautiful Song, Alien Manifestation, Wretched Weaponry, Sound of the End, Emil/Despair... I could go on, and on, and on. It's the kind of soundtrack you can make a concert out of, and, actually, it's already been done!
A lot of its deep story, lore and subtle existential commentary (50%, give or take), however, are presented indirectly through written dialogue, memoirs, or second-hand narration, which can be off-putting if you don't like reading much, or a good thing, depending on your preference. It's there if you want to look for it, but, again, you need to be the kind of player who can commit to a 50-hour thoughtful playthrough to appreciate it fully.
Much in the same vein, the gameplay and combat are also something you will only see in this game - a mixture of hack-and-slash, ranged combat, mech battles and mini-games, with a changing camera angle from up-close or far away, in a classic third-person or lateral 2.5 D fashion, and sometimes even from above, depending on where you are. If it sounds confusing, it isn't! It all flows and shifts surprisingly well, and truly, there is nothing else like it.

Overall, Nier:Automata is a game that you should probably try at least once, if you like games in general. It really is a one of a kind, remarkable experience.

184959286.review:
[h1] NieR: Automata [/h1]

Gosto de pensar que NieR é um jogo feito por humanos que jogamos como androides que ao longo da trama, tentamos entender e compreender toda a complexidade humana, suas ambições, emoções, independente se são racionais ou não. NieR nos leva para tantos cantos durante essa jogatina. Estamos na pele de 2B e acompanhados por 9S em um mundo devastado, nós, androides da corporação YoRHa somos a última salvação para a raça humana, estamos lá para restaurar o planeta das máquinas que estão dominando o lugar. Com esta premissa embarcamos em uma jornada que jamais poderíamos pensar experienciar, reflexões e questionamentos que os personagens fazem para si que tocam aqueles que estão jogando, além de uma aclamada trilha sonora, acontecimentos que apenas nos deixa vidrados em tudo que podemos experimentar desta obra. NieR nos entrega um mundo vasto para ser explorado com um combate dinâmico e frenético em cada encontro, além da possibilidade de realizar combos com set de armas diferentes, drones e por aí vai, o jogo nos entrega uma ótima experiência em nos divertir como videogame, assim faz o mesmo com a história e seus dilemas.

[i] Tentarei realizar esta review sem spoilers, caso tenha, estará ocultado. [/i]

[h2] Ritmo [/h2]

NieR pode não ser um jogo para todo mundo, apesar de ter opções de dificuldades podendo deixar a experiência mais tranquila, o jogo é extenso, a forma como foi criado e pensado para ter esta experiência é algo único que experienciei enquanto jogava, a história do jogo não termina quando os créditos começam a descer, o jogo em si possui 5 finais principais e mais 21 que seriam secundários, é possível você conseguir alguns desses finais secundários sem querer enquanto você está jogando, mas poderá voltar do último ponto salvo, então lembre sempre de estar salvando seu jogo. Os finais principais de NieR Automata seriam 5 jogatinas do começo ao fim, mas cada uma delas nos entregando experiências diferentes, perspectivas diferentes de uma única história, completando algumas das lacunas que poderia ter enquanto jogou pela primeira vez.

[h2] Combate [/h2]

O jogo possui certa variedade de inimigos para se enfrentar, sendo as máquinas, androides e até mesmo animais que continuam vagando pelo planeta, alguns destes inimigos podem sim causar um certo trabalho para você, mas o jogo nos entrega mais do que o suficiente para que estes encontros não sejam sufocantes, o combate é lindo de se ver, o sistema de esquiva perfeita ativa alguns neurônios meus cada vez que realizo uma, simplesmente muito satisfatório ver tudo ficando em câmera lenta e em preto e branco quando desvio de algum golpe. Joguei na dificuldade normal do jogo na primeira jogatina e na segunda eu subi um pouco, os inimigos dão mais dano e perdi a assistência de mira com o drone que temos como suporte. Sinceramente, o combate ele te prende a fazer os combos, ver os inimigos explodindo, as animações e efeitos visuais, mas em determinado momento eu senti que nada ali seria perigoso, nada ali poderia realmente me eliminar, mas o jogo consegue criar essa tensão, esse medo de morrer em um combate.

[h3] Chefes [/h3]

Ainda é fresco na minha mente o meu espanto ao ter a melhor batalha de chefe de tutorial da minha vida enquanto estava em call com alguns amigos, eu estava chocado, impressionado com aquilo que passava na minha tela, as trilhas sonoras das batalhas, a luta em si, algumas dela mudando a mecânica de combate, mudança de câmeras durante o combate, me deixando tão conectado com aquilo, para mim, ter lutado contra a Dançarina de Ferro, das vezes que precisei enfrentá-la, você sai sem palavras, sem reação, a batalha é bela, os questionamentos atrás da beleza da Dançarina são tão profundos e humano. Não são todos os chefes que são memoráveis, alguns podem sim passar despercebidos, e alguns outros eu não consideraria um chefe, mas, cada batalha tenta mudar um pouco em como enfrentar esse desafio que está na sua frente.

[h2] Exploração e Missões [/h2] 

Nesse mundo devastado ainda é possível encontrar beleza enquanto vagamos pelas ruínas das cidades, pelo árido deserto onde já abrigou tanta vida naquele lugar. O bosque do Pascal, o parque de diversões, a costa, a fábrica abandonada, os nomes são simples, por talvez ser como os humanos descreveriam aquele lugar, cada local brinca um pouco com suas percepções, a que me fez virar uma chave e entender que isso não era qualquer jogo, foi bem no parque de diversões, quando matei sem pensar aquelas máquinas por serem meus inimigos e perceber que nenhuma delas realmente estava me atacando ou sendo hostil, elas estavam festejando e trazendo alegria para o parque assim como os humanos faziam.

As missões secundárias do jogo podem te fazer explorar os cantos deste mapa, ver coisas, encontrar novas linhas de diálogos que pode carregar aquela pepita de ouro no meio, cada momento ali vale a pena, nós como androides somos feitos para ajudar também, contextualmente, faz sentido termos que realizar as missões secundárias e consequentemente estamos auxiliando a raça humana, tome seu tempo ou apenas siga para as missões principais, apesar de ter sistema do personagem evoluir em níveis, isso não te impede muito de seguir a história.

[h2] Minha experiência [/h2]

Esse jogo me manteve preso até final, fiz os finais principais, já tinha realizado alguns finais secundários, mas após completar sua, 5° run, é desbloqueado um NPC onde você pode comprar todas as conquistas desse jogo, e foi isso que fiz, algo que para mim estava deixando ser um problema era jogar jogos para platinar e não jogar jogos, então, eu só fui atrás desta platina após terminar a história desse jogo e jogar no meu ritmo, sentir no meu ritmo.

Pontos que me pegaram é toda a trama que envolve 9S, a história da vila do Pascal e cada um destes plot twist que o jogo nos entrega, um dos finais cravou esse jogo como a melhor experiência com jogos da minha vida, não tem como descrever isso, mas tem um que ficou na minha mente, [b] O que é a perfeição? [/b]

Acompanhamos uma história onde androides podem emular os sentimentos, mas são proibidos de sentir, vemos máquinas com processamentos lógicos básico se importar e demonstrar o que é preocupação por conta de um filho que fugiu, vemos dilemas que nós humanos nos perdemos por conta de beleza e aceitação, você vê essas máquinas lidando com esses problemas sem mascarar seu sofrimento, máquinas demonstrando lealdade e respeito a um líder caído, protegendo aquilo que lhe é mais precioso, essa mesma máquinas que são nossos inimigos, que derrotamos uma a uma, não eram para elas sentirem, não eram para elas terem esse comportamento, é você que irá apertar o gatilho, é você que decidirá se essa máquina deve morrer por mais que não expresse nenhuma hostilidade, o jogo te faz questionar, te faz pensar, não apenas seguir ordens e ir do ponto A ao B.

Podemos ter essa busca pela perfeição, querendo saber de tudo, ser poderosos, ricos e capazes de conquistar tudo aquilo que queremos, uma ambição ousada, um desejo que não nos cabe em seres tão pequeno, mas para as máquinas, essa ambição que elas possuem também é ousada, elas almejam ser humanas e o que mais seria tão humano quanto sentir, amar, chorar e até mesmo errar? Em NieR vimos em uma das tramas uma máquina que após analisar tantos a história humana que ela se torna falha, ela erra propositalmente, mas isso seria ser falho? isso é ser humano?

[b] O que é ser humano? [/b]

Realmente espero que deem uma chance para esse jogo, além disso, existe um anime com uma belíssima animação também, eu não assisti, mas claramente a experiência completa seria o jogo, espero que tenham gostado desta review platinada, nem sempre é sobre conquistar todas as conquistas difíceis e grindar por horas, eu me contentei com aquilo que senti e vivi nessas horas que entreguei no jogo. Obrigado para quem leu até este momento e nos vemos em outra review com platina.

184952551.review:
The game is a lot of fun and really shines when it makes you feel uncomfortable. There are moments during side quests and the main story that really made me go "woah". The combat is fun and there's a lot of room for experimentation in it. I 100%'d the game so I obviously really enjoyed it, but it does have a few issues. Personally, I was not as impressed with the story as some. It really shines in terms of unique, beautiful characters and the relationships between them, especially 2B and 9S, but the main plot leaves much to be desired. It's very easy to predict the main "twist" of the story, and none of the endings really gave me much fulfillment. In fact, the majority of the endings are "joke" endings, and the same "joke" is used for about 8 endings: "*insert character* ran away from the battle leaving everyone else to die! LOL". I would have liked to seen more thought out, interesting alternate endings with more cutscenes. 

In addition, some of the side quests are given to you WAY too early on route A. You may be given a quest where you're level 20 facing waves of level 35 enemies, or a quest where you're level 30 facing a level 60 bullet sponge that you do barely any damage to. Why they didn't just give you these quests on route C, I have no idea, but it doesn't ever feel good as a player to be given content that you have no chance of beating. 

Overall, I really enjoyed this game and would recommend it to anyone who likes RPGs, but it does have some issues that aren't really talked about since it's a popular game with such a dedicated fanbase.

184923123.review:
I think the gameplay, progression system, enemy design, combat and all that jazz is fine.

The problem I have is with the story. See the game sets up the setting, premise and narrative direction for you (2B and 9S) only to undermine it at every turn, leaving huge gaps in its place, confusing things and misdirecting you with red herrings that really doesn't matter all to say in path C ("third playthrough") "lol, nothing matters, nihilism yo! LMAO!" 

The story in itself doesn't have any proper narrative direction and it just feels like a child writing "and then this happened, and then this happened, and then this happened-" completely forgetting about where it started and how it all ties together. 

It isn't until path C that it starts to formulate into some kind of a direction and at that point the story, setting and premise doesn't make any damn sense to me anymore. 

It's basically JJ Abrahams mystery box storytelling where nothing is ever properly wrapped up and nothing really ties together to form a larger whole and none of the characters actions or motivations really mean anything.

And the sad part about it is that while this is a problem in Path A and Path B it isn't until Path C (which I would say is, I dunno, roughly 20-30 hours into the game depending on how much side content you do?) that the nihilism kicks in and everything you've done feel completely meaningless.

There are interesting philosophical elements in the game, absolutely, but they do not make up for the absolute clusterduck that is the premise, setting and main story.

So I guess the question to you is how much you care about a satisfying conclusion to a story. If your barometer for good storytelling is really really low (meaning you have no discernment of taste or quality due to a lack of critical thinking) then I'm sure you're going to enjoy this game. But for anyone who keeps an eye on things and remember the past events will start to put A and B and C together to say "this doesn't make any sense".

It sucks that it doesn't happen until Path C cause at that point, well, it's way too late to refund the game so you're stuck with it now. Might as well wrap it up.

And if anyone want to say "but the codex entries bla bla bla": Show, don't tell. 

The game, weeb'ness aside, is solid and I'd argue that Path A and B even if they don't have a big finalé and obviously leave questions unanswered it is best to leave those questions unanswered and just enjoy the moment there and quit the game at that point.

184892956.review:
At first glance, this might seem like a typical game that leans heavily into stereotypical Japanese fetishes, with character designs that are unapologetically fan-service driven. However, it quickly reveals an unexpectedly rich narrative and intricate lore, likely persuading players to explore Yoko Taro's previous works for a deeper understanding of its broader context. The story might appear simple at first, but it eventually evolves into one that constantly offers subtle yet powerful moments that prompt the players to reflect on their own beliefs, with philosophical themes—particularly Existentialism—at its core.

While the visuals may not be groundbreaking by any means, the game more than makes up for it with a beautifully crafted soundtrack that enhances each moment, adding an unique layer to every location and further expanding its emotional impact with variants under specific circumstances, such as during boss battles. 
The gameplay, though slightly dated, remains polished and enjoyable. It's primarily a hack-and-slash game, with certain segments shifting to a 3D scroller or top-down shooter. The end result is a story-driven game packed with action where these various gameplay styles are seamlessly integrated, offering a smooth experience for players who enjoy these genres.

One of the most important, yet easily overlooked features of the game is the plug-in chip mechanic, which plays a crucial role in tailoring gameplay to the player’s style. This system allows players to enhance or adjust their character's skills, adding a layer of strategy and personalization, such as buffing combat abilities or fine-tuning skills for specific challenges, making each playthrough feel unique. Combined with the game’s multiple endings, this offers plenty of replay value, giving reasons for players to return and experience all 26 possible endings.

In the end, this game is much more than it initially appears. It blends captivating storytelling with a solid gameplay experience, leaving players with a lasting impression. It's a game that truly feels made with love and passion from the developers, and although it's not without its flaws, it ultimately is one of those rare gem titles that every fan of Japanese culture should experience.

Final rating: 9S/10

Eu tinha uma visão um pouco negativa sobre esse jogo, achava que era só uma meia bomba com fan service pra agradar um certo público, mas estava errado. Nier Automata é um RPG de mundo aberto que impressiona com sua história e uma soundtrack maravilhosa, que, inclusive, ganhou um prêmio no TGA 2018. Sobre os pontos negativos, eu diria apenas o fator de rejogabilidade, que não é ruim, longe disso, mas pode acabar afastando muitos que estão começando. Para conseguir o final E (final verdadeiro), você precisa jogar pelo menos umas três vezes (para alcançar os finais A, B e C) e fazer escolhas diferentes para desbloquear outros dois (D e E). Contudo, a experiência de jogar Nier pela primeira vez é simplesmente perfeita, e, por favor, aprenda sobre o sistema de chips. Não faça como eu, que cheguei na rota C sem upar e tomei pra dentro.

Dito isso, jogaço da porra, e obrigado meu amigo Joaquim por ter me recomendado essa masterpiece.

184854377.review:
O mundo do jogo é aberto e permite que os cenários sejam explorados livremente pelos personagens, além de oferecer missões paralelas e áreas secretas. O mapa não é gigantesco em extensão, mas aproveita de forma inteligente a verticalidade das construções. Em certas missões, é necessário retornar a um ponto já visitado, apenas renovado com outros inimigos.

Um ponto a ser ressaltado é que certas atividades secundárias são desbloqueadas somente depois de finalizar a campanha pela primeira vez – algumas, inclusive, exigem dois finais –, o que estimula a vontade de repetir toda a jornada, especialmente depois de um final surpreendente.

Por se tratar de um RPG, Automata traz um amplo sistema de progressão, que possibilita equipar itens e mods para melhorar os atributos dos personagens. A ideia de misturar hack and slash com a densidade dos RPGs é ambiciosa e funciona de forma satisfatória, ainda que a interface seja bastante confusa.

Nier: Automata consegue reunir o que há de melhor em dois gêneros – hack and slash e RPG – para entregar uma experiência viciante, ainda que tenha problemas de ritmo e não seja tão original. O combate sólido e o incrível mundo aberto, cuidadosamente projetado, despertam a curiosidade para conhecer todos os finais.

<3 2B

只有音乐能算还可以吧。剧情不行，玩法也不行。建议不要浪费时间。
剧情的话要角色没角色，要逻辑没逻辑，悬念有一点但是后面解开时很让人失望，高潮的冲突来源与一些机缘巧合而没有信念的碰撞，结局开放式。编剧还傲慢地将自己的想法赋予机器人然后在游戏里感叹为什么机器人总想要成为人类，一定是因为人类有什么特别的地方吧。你这么写很没有意思。玩法一周目像是动作游戏，但是二周目开始就一转黑白色彩的弹幕射击，后面主要就是这个了。大量支线叫你超远距离跑腿，有的还是跑多个地点，最后给的奖励又很幽默。武器只有四个模组其他都是改改数值。支线和地图探索都缺少奖励支撑。抛开支线的话最大的问题是老喜欢改我的操作，比如调我的视角，即使我再转开它还会再调回来，很晕车。其他会跑着跑着变成走了，经常跳出语音，语音时不能存档和对话，语音结束才会给出下一个目的地，而且没有办法跳到下一句或者直接跳过语音。你将会在时不时踉跄一下变成走路的超远距离往返跑和不能跳过的语音中浪费你的人生。

184712556.review:
If you're thinking of buying this game, you've probably heard several people gushing about how it's one of the best games they've ever played, it changed the way they think about life, they cried multiple times, etc. etc.

I agree with those people. But there's a caveat: I didn't find this game particularly interesting until about 20 hours in, and I didn't think it was phenomenal until about 30 hours in. That's a *lot* to invest. If I hadn't had four days off with no real plans I would have dropped this game far before I got to that point. So let me try to explain some of my issues with the game to help you figure out if the juice is worth the squeeze.

The cons:

[list]
    [*]If you are experienced with action games, you will find the combat shallow.
        [list=1][*]Your only viable defensive options are dodge and parry. But you can cancel basically anything into a dodge, so there's no reason not to just be mashing an attack and then hit the dodge button whenever you need it. As a result, you don't really need to be *aware* of anything, and the game really boils down to "how many attack animations do you have memorized", which gets old real damn fast.
        [*] There's no "hook" for combat like there are for other Platinum games. DMC has the Style meter to push you to take risks or use "bad" moves, Bayonetta has Dodge Offset to encourage you to abuse strings, The Wonderful 101 has the drawing mechanic that adds a space requirement to special move buffers. Nier: Automata has, ostensibly, the Pod system, but in practice this just made my finger sore because there's really no reason *not* to be firing your pod 24/7 in combat (with the exception of if you're trying to charge a pod skill, but the skills have such huge cooldowns and such long charge times I never found there was an incentive to use them).
        [*] the TL;DR of this section is the combat largely consists of mashing <your attack button of choice> and hitting Dodge when an enemy's eyes flash red. There are brief detours where you have to play a twin-stick shooter hacking minigame, but these use a limited pool of preset levels and by the end of the game I was pretty sick of them, too. The combat wore out its welcome, fast, and quickly became a slog for me.[/list]
    [*]The writing is mediocre for the first 20 hours.
        [list=1][*]You're probably aware that this game needs multiple playthroughs to get the full story. But as a result of this structure, the first playthrough has a pretty bad story. Things kind of just happen. Characters monologue nonsensically at you. Cryptic events and notes litter the world and engaging with them goes nowhere. You can *try* to piece some stuff together, but so much information is hidden from you that most things are incomprehensible, and what *is* comprehensible is just super generic sci-fi post-apocalyptic action game schlock. I think it's perfectly reasonable at this point to wonder "is any of this well thought-out, or is the story just ambiguous and vague because the writer actually had nothing to say?"[/list]
    [*]This game isn't shy at all about wasting your time.
        [list=1][*]A lot of the side quests legitimately go nowhere, and this is super frustrating because they're impossible to distinguish between the side quests with actual narrative payoff. Most sidequests are shallow fetch affairs that are largely just excuses to throw combat arenas at you (and sometimes not even then, I swear like half the side quests in this game are "Fast travel here. Mash dash for five minutes to get to this NPC and talk to it. Mash dash for five minutes again to get back to the fast travel point and fast travel back to the quest giver). But every once in a while something incredibly shallow and stupid will take a hard right and end in something incredibly poignant and beautiful, so you kinda just have to waste your time doing all the side quests. Sort of a microcosm of my feelings at large on this game.[/list]
[/list]

The pros:
[list][*]A thoughtful, compelling story, told in a very unique way.
    [list=1][*]A lot of this game's problems stem from how ambitious it is and the unique way it tells its story. The combat is shallow because there's three playable characters and three full stories for each of them, and there presumably wasn't budget to flesh out their movesets ala DMCV. The story is tripe at first because it's designed to have the most impact when new information recontextualizes old events, so there have to be gaps in your understanding for it to work. Even the ridiculous fetch quests that make you backtrack through the map multiple times have a kind of payoff: [spoiler]The world map changes multiple times, and by making you walk through the map so much, you get so familiar with it that seeing it post-major-event is chilling[/spoiler]. So, if the cons don't sound like they'll be dealbreakers for you, then buy this game -- you'll be rewarded with a very unique, very memorable experience.[/list][/list]

(Also absolutely do not buy this game if you're not comfortable with a controller. It's got twin-stick shooter elements; mouse and keyboard controls are unplayably bad.)

184690668.review:
[u] The masterpiece which saved PlatinumGames [/u]

It was a great idea to combine the singular and art-house vision of Yoko Taro and PlatinumGames, a studio that has created many iconic games,but became failures because they were exclusives for different platforms.... 
And this symbiosis saved a great studio and gave us this wonderful and already iconic game!

I only realized why people love this game only when I played through all main endings, but 9S part was... I don't want to talk about those hacking moments, I thought I was going to lose my sanity as 9S before the end of the game.

But after-all it's a great game: good story and gameplay, amazing music and art style. And it's nice too see how this game and first Nier are connected, like it's all a cycle: 
1. Again 3 characters:  
- 2B/2E is like Nier, 
- 9S is like Emil and instead of magic he has hacking 
- A2 is like Kainé
2. Same old story and danger, but a little bit different and etc 
To be honest I regret buying this game on sale, it deserve the full price, maybe not when it was released on PC, but definitely now. Buy it if you like games from PlatinumGamesor or melancholy/art-house stories  

Glory to Yoko Taro and Akihiko Yoshida for 2B, you've created one of the most iconic female characters!

184687993.review:
Nier is my favorite game

The game is full of side quests that require you to back track, to fetch meaningless garbage. To revisit areas over and over again for no reason. I did the vast majority of this prior to unlocking the quick travel system and frankly I wouldn't want it any other way.

The game asks you to waste your time, it TELLS YOU that its wasting your time, but more than that it tells you that there is no such thing as wasting your time. That everything has meaning as long as you are willing to believe it does.

The game adamantly believes everything has an intrinsic meaning not because of a higher power, but because to have meaning is to be art, to be beautiful and emotionally evocative. Even if everything is blown away in the grains of sand, to have existed at all, to have been an experience, that is what truly matters. 

Is the game perfect? No, are there parts that are horribly unfun? absolutely, but to me, that doesn't matter. This game oozes with passion and that is all I care about.

184667686.review:
[h1]Nier: Automata  [/h1]
[b] Nier: Automata [/b]особисто для мене — Це гра, яка змусила задуматися над речами, про які рідко замислюєшся. Що робить людину людиною? Чи можуть андроїди відчувати емоції? І чому герої, які за своєю суттю механізми, викликають більше співчуття, ніж багато персонажів-людей в інших іграх та навіть в реальному житті?

[b] Філософія у пікселях[/b]
Це не типова історія про добро і зло. Гра ставить складні питання: чи сняться роботам електричні вівці? Як виглядає людяність у світі, де люди вже не існують? І як знайти сенс у війні, якщо ти створений лише для того, щоб боротися?
Мені дуже сподобалося, як гра показує андроїдів не просто машинами. Вони мають емоції, мрії, страхи — і це змушує дивитися на них зовсім інакше.

[b] Геймплей, що розповідає історію[/b]
На перший погляд здається, що це звичайний слешер. Але [b]Nier: Automata [/b]постійно змінює жанри: тут і динамічні бої, і платформер, і шутер. Це додає грі різноманітності, але що важливіше — ці зміни завжди підкреслюють атмосферу світу.
Коли все здається хаотичним, гра нагадує, що життя теж часто непередбачуване.

[b] Музика, яку не забудеш[/b]
Я закохався у саундтрек цієї гри. Його неможливо сплутати з чимось іншим. Музика ідеально доповнює атмосферу, змушуючи переживати кожен момент ще глибше. Вона ніби розповідає власну історію. Це той випадок, коли хочеться переслуховувати треки і після проходження.

[b] Емоції, які змушують співчувати[/b]
Головні герої — андроїди 2B, 9S і A2 — зроблені для війни. Але за цією зовнішньою холодністю приховано стільки емоцій, що ти мимоволі починаєш їм співчувати. Їхні внутрішні конфлікти, пошуки сенсу життя і навіть дрібні моменти спілкування — це все дуже чіпляє.

[b] Чому варто зіграти?[/b]
Це історія про постапокаліпсис, яка показує, що стане з планетою, якщо люди раптово зникнуть. Світ гри вражає контрастом природи та залишків людської цивілізації, де дерева проростають крізь хмарочоси, а механізми воюють на руїнах колишньої величі.
При цьому це годний слешер із продуманою системою прокачки, яка дозволяє налаштовувати персонажів під свій стиль гри. А ще тут неймовірна кількість кінцівок — від епічних і драматичних до жартівливих і несподіваних. Гра дарує унікальний досвід і точно залишиться у пам’яті.

184642989.review:
NieR: Automata es un juego sólido que combina acción, narrativa y música de manera efectiva. Ofrece combates dinámicos y variados, mezclando hack and slash con secciones de bullet hell, lo que le da un toque diferente a la jugabilidad.

La historia es interesante, con un enfoque en temas existenciales y filosóficos, aunque personalmente no me pareció especialmente impactante ni algo que me dejara reflexionando después de jugar. La dirección artística está bien hecha y complementa la narrativa, pero tampoco resulta particularmente impresionante.

En general, es un buen juego, pero no lo considero una experiencia que destaque tanto como se suele decir. Si buscas un título entretenido y diferente, puede ser una buena opción, pero no esperes que te cambie la vida.
