184630361.review:
NieR: Automata – «Игра, пробуждающая душу»

NieR: Automata – это не просто игра, а настоящий философский опыт, открывающий перед игроком мир эмоций, экзистенциальных вопросов и тройных сюжетных поворотов. В этой игре каждый элемент – от геймплея до музыки – работает на создание уникальной атмосферы, которая задает задуматься о жизни, смерти и смысле существования.

Сюжет: "Философия, скрытая под маской экшена"
Сюжет NieR: Automata – это сложная и многослойная история, которая, на первый взгляд, может показаться типичным постапокалипсисом, но постепенно раскрывается как глубокая и философская притча о человечности. В этой игре вам предстоит играть за андроидов, выступающих за человека, но с каждым шагом они начинают задавать вопросы о том, что с

Каждая из трех сюжетных линий представляет собой не просто изложение одних и тех же событий, а глубокий взгляд на мир через разные призмы, дающий невероятную глубину каждому персонажу. Повороты сюжета неожидан, а в финале игры остается след, который невозможен

Геймплей: "Экшн, который не просто развлекает, а заставляет задуматься"
Геймплей NieR: Automata содержит динамические экшен-изображения с элементами RPG, что делает сражение не только интересным, но и необычно стильным. Это не просто стандартные действия, а настоящий танец с врагами, где важно не только правильно выбирать оружие, но читать поведение противников, комбинировать атаки и использовать

Каждый бит

«Мир, живущий своей трагедией»
Мир NieR: Automata – это постапокалипсис, который выглядит по-настоящему мертвым и заброшенным. Развалины старого мира и пустынные ландшафты создают атмосферу безнадежности и тоски. Но несмотря на это, мир наполнен деталями, рассказывающими свою историю, будь то обломки сданы или летающие работы. Это не просто декорации, а целая история,

Звуковое оформление игры также обеспечивает особое внимание. Музыка, написанная Кэйдзи Ёсимото, идеально дополняет атмосферу игры и порой становится не главным элементом повествования. Каждая композиция соответствует моменту игры

Персонажи: "Андроиды с душой"
Персонажи игры, включая андроиды 2B и 9S, становятся не просто инструментами для прохождения миссии, а нынешними героями, с которыми хочется пройти весь путь. Их эволюция, как личности, и их восприятие мира со временем меняется, заставляющая игрока задумываться о смысле жизни и о том, что отличает их от людей. Несмотря на свое искусственное происхождение, персонажи играют на чувствах и демонстрируют настоящую человечность в самых неожиданных моментах.

Итог: "Игра, которая меняет взгляд на жизнь и игры"
NieR: Automata – это не просто игра, а целый опыт. Это история о том, что значит быть живым, что значит бороться за то, что больше, чем просто существование. Игровой процесс, сюжет, персонажи, музыка – все это работает на создание того неповторимого ощущения, которое будет с вами еще долго после того.

Оценка: 10/10. Невозможно не пережить эту игру. Она задает чувство, думать и проживать каждый момент.

184502894.review:
This was quite a ride. This game is just built different. Story is multilayered, everything is connected and the perspective will change plenty of times to show almost everything.
Combat is fairly easy. Most likely the Prologue boss will be the hardest enemy for the rest of the game. I'll say even more - it's safe to start the game on Hard. Your first Route A playthrough will be challenging, but the rest will still feel easy. 
As an Asian game there's plenty of farming. Like real MMO-style farming. If you want 100%, get ready to Netflix and chill while you're reloading spawn-points waiting for that one specific enemy-type.
Fishing rare fish can also takes hours.
However all of that only complements the game world. 
The only thing I would love is a proper New Game+. To have level 1 character start, but with all the unlocks.

184487477.review:
This game is a timeless masterpiece. It's an intimate tapestry of thought-provoking themes such as the nature of humanity, life and death, futility of conflict, free will and determinism, identity and self-awareness, and the illusion of superiority.

2B. A2. Do I really need to say anything!!? Nier set the benchmark for digital eye candy and paved the way for games like Stellar Blade. The OST is exceptional. Production and art direction is a cool blend of 2D, 2.5D and 3D environments (retro gamers will love this). Combat is super stylish and fast-paced. There are some awesome RPG chips that look cool in combat with cinematic effects (like slowing time with perfect evade).

Map design can be confusing and frustrating at first but I was navigating it like a seasoned pro by the end of the game. There are a lot of secret areas (loved these). Graphics quality is decent (also it runs and looks great on the Steam Deck). However, the thing I love about this game is that it plays well beyond its years and I believe that in time it will be widely recognized as a masterful work of art.

All in all, it's a masterpiece and an excellent entry in the JRPG genre. I played it at launch in 2017 and again in 2024. It was even better the second time round. That in itself speaks volumes. I cannot express my love for this game enough.

184476321.review:
This was one of the toughest thumbs up / thumbs down decisions I've had on a Steam review, but at the end of the day, if I would rather uninstall than replay for alternate endings (despite the developers basically begging the player to do so at the end of the first playthrough) and if I have zero intention to ever pick up the sequel, I think it has to be a thumbs down for me. The bones of this game are fabulous, but the good content is too watered down to be worth playing.

Let's start with the good:
* An interesting main story complete with excellent world-building.
* Fresh, fun combat that combines elements of hack and slash and bullet hell.
* Extremely cool perspective changes both in combat and while navigating the environment. I don't think I've ever played a game that does this, and it was shown off beautifully in the opening sequence.
* Exceptional bosses.
* Excellent soundtrack that I think they may have created their own language for.
* Interesting characters.
* More than its fair share of cuteness: [spoiler]the "androids are scary~", little sister, and momma robots, Pascal, 6O, etc.[/spoiler]
* Excellent animations.

However, while there are some really high highs, the majority of this game was just...boring. There was too much running from point A to point B, too many fetch quests, too much waiting for the enemy that is randomly 10 levels higher than you to finally die because you don't want to have to come back, etc. Are there people out there who unironically enjoy fishing minigames, protect quests, or fighting the same infinitely respawning open world trash mobs? Some of the side missions were an absolute misery of backtracking / repetition [spoiler](e.g. the human artifact mission in the desert)[/spoiler] and it felt like their only purpose was to pad the game's playtime. There were a couple of really adorable side quests that I would have been sad to miss and those little drips of dopamine kept me going for a while, but I just constantly found myself with my eyes glazing over wishing I could go back to having fun.

The worst part is, the game is aware of how terrible it can be, [i]and yet they chose to leave that content in the game[/i]. For example, 
* As we ran all over creation during the first side mission I attempted, 9S complained, "Man, these chores are really a pain in the butt, huh?" The achievement I got for it was called "First [i]Errand[/i]".
* After a certain main story event far from an access point, the game forces you to backtrack a long distance instead of teleporting you back to camp (as it does for some other missions). 9S remarks "Back this way again? What a pain."
* When they finally give you access to fast travel after several hours of mind-numbing backtracking, 9S remarks: "About time we got access to these!"
* There's an NPC who will commiserate with you about how terrible and hard to read the 3D map is.

If this game had been a tight, mostly linear 10-12 hour experience that condensed its best moments, I would be singing its praises from the rooftops. Unfortunately this game is yet another casualty of the open world fad with playtime utterly divorced from the amount of content in it. Ask anyone who liked this game what the best part was and they'll probably say the story/world/bosses/combat. Literally nobody is going to mention how thrilled they were to press B hundreds of times on random glowy objects so that they can gather enough resources to craft a 10% damage boost for their ranged attack.

Now, it must be said that I am writing this review after (merely!) finishing the first playthrough. I am aware that there is more content if you start another playthrough. However, [spoiler]the additional playthroughs mostly [i]aren't[/i] new content; they mostly rehash the same events from another perspective. You do fill in a couple of the major plot holes from the first playthrough, but this game is simply not good enough to want to replay it from another perspective. They already have you backtracking through all of the regions several times for various side missions; why would I want to spend even more time in these environments for a bit more plot when I could just read the wiki? The devs' misguided expectation that players will opt for multiple playthroughts detracts from the experience of playing through the game the first time.[/spoiler]

Other frustrations:
* This is a terrible port. It looks stuttery even at a stable 60 FPS and your GPU still has to crank to render the relatively ugly game world.
* Many key characters have only half of their lines voiced. Sometimes characters would voice like two lines of a conversation and you'd have to read the rest. This felt awkward and rushed.
* Several side quests are not remotely doable by the end of your first playthrough because the enemies are 20+ levels above you. Similarly, the game will sometimes decide that you're not allowed to do side missions and the only indication of that will be that you can't interact with the appropriate NPC. In both cases it'll let you hike all the way out there to find out the hard way.
* You finally get access to the shops that allow you to increase your chip capacity about two hours before the end of the first playthrough.
* You don't get access to fast travel until about halfway through the first playthrough.
* 9S is such an irritating companion. He follows your exact path and stops right behind you when you stop moving. That means he'll frequently block you if you try to turn around, especially in the quasi-2D sections, and prevent you from interacting with NPCs and objects as well. It's also hard to tell 2B and 9S apart in the heat of battle with some of the fixed camera angles because they basically look the same at a distance and they're always right next to each other. [spoiler]The A2 boss fight was the peak of the misery, as A2 also looks like 2B and 9S while zoomed out.[/spoiler]
* The map sucks. It forgets its last zoom level and perspective, there's no way to remove a placed marker, and it rotates by default but there's no compass.
* Every time I walked into the desert during a certain slice of the main story, the same audio message played. It also prevented me from interacting with NPCs, access points, etc. until it finished.
* Sometimes if you pause the game you get a generic "PAUSED" message as if it were a cut-scene instead of the proper pause menu. This happens when you're riding animals, for example, which means that you're unable to use the map without dismounting.
* The sand slide is so buggy that you frequently can't stop to pick up items, interact with NPCs, or even fast travel because you character just keeps sliding.
* [spoiler]YoRHa Betrayers is important to how you perceive the main story, but it's a side mission that requires a lot of RNG to complete, so people are either going to miss it or do it way after it gets introduced.[/spoiler]
* [spoiler]Why is 2B suddenly concerned with the teleporter paradox when 9S gets corrupted? She spent most of the game travelling via teleporter. Is she really that concerned that he's going to lose a few minutes of his memories? The sex metaphor was clear at the end, but why 2B decided to kill 9S by choking his robot neck instead of stabbing him like Eve made no sense and made the moment fall apart for me. Why prolong the suffering of someone you clearly care for?[/spoiler]

184454827.review:
Nier: Automata — гениальная игра от гениальных ускоглазых парней, я рад, что такие проекты существуют в мире. Узнал об игре из-за жопы 2B, а оказалось, там еще и A2 есть. Хоть разгуливает не в таком крышесносном наряде, но тоже пойдет. Все же на игру есть моды, которые позволяют воплотить все потребности.

Мне очень зашел сюжет и его подача. История разворачивается так, что сначала ты просто наслаждаешься экшеном, боями и красивыми пейзажами, а потом вдруг осознаешь, что тебя втянули в глубокую философскую драму. Спойлерить ниче не буду, но проходя игру на 100% мне было жалко персонажей и роботов..

Финалы — отдельная тема. Сначала кажется, что это просто много разных концовок, но когда доходишь до финала E, понимаешь, что игра ломает четвертую стену и заставляет задуматься о том, что даже ты, как игрок, являешься частью этой истории. Ты переживаешь, злишься, грустишь и радуешься вместе с персонажами.

А еще музыка! Саундтреки — это просто ДРАНЫЙ БОЖЕСТВЕННЫЙ НАБОР НОТ, я никогда не прикасался к инструментам, но люди которые писали эти песни походу с ними спят и занимаются сексом каждый день

Геймплей — идеальный. Боевая система 2 кнопки, НО КАК ЖЕ ОНО СМОТРИТСЯ. Переходы между жанрами (от слэшера к шутеру или платформеру) происходят настолько плавно, что удивляешься, как хорошо это все работает. Локации в игре потрясают своей атмосферой и простотой (я знаю что японцы делают упор в диалоги и.тд.)

Nier: Automata — это больше, чем просто игра, это настоящий шедевр, который остается с тобой надолго. Проект, который стоит пройти каждому, кто хочет не только развлечься, но и испытать целую гамму эмоций.

Внатуре четко.

打1分，给音乐。

184444217.review:
The most peak waifu-game to depression coaster you'll ever play.
Came for the honeys and stayed for the weird yet interesting story, including but not limited to:

Mecha fights with the budget of the box office performance on the highly anticipated Sonic The Hedgehog 2, the emotional heart-wrench of acting through the combination of hand-animated and motion capture scenes, as well as stellar voice acting in both your choice of english-dub and weeb.
Combat that breaks through but still embraces it's predecessor 'NieR Gestalt' for those on the Xbox 360, but those on Playstation 3 know it as 'NieR Replicant' while the same game but different time periods, decided to stick to the PS3's name because it's just easier.
But combined both time periods from both consoles to the now popular 'Nier Replicant ver.22474487139' for all platforms (that matter).
But back to the combat, not only can you dual wield greatswords, you can have two sets of weapons at your disposal, while huffing E-Drugs with charged up counter attacks with a chip system that lets you boost your efficiency in depopulating the automaton menace.
Did I mention you can max out your damage with gacha chips that you install 1 of 128 cpu slots somewhere on 2B.
Along with you partner, 9S, who doesn't know where the wind comes from, you can change his behavior to match your playstyle, but better left to default so you can maximize beheading the mechanicals.
Holding a candlelight for it's odd but nostalgic camera angles in specific areas that make you question what kind of game it is, but less so than the last game, the aforementioned NieR Replicant.
There's serious moments in the story but a whole lot of fetch quests that remind you of RPGs of the past, but at the same time turn to wtf moments but the other half of the spectrum comes in the depression saga, with adaptive music that will stay with you forever if you've an ounce of these things called Sympathy, and Empathy by the time you reach the conclusion of certain questlines.
Though most of those prohibited emotions will be in-use when putting down robots, of all shapes, sizes, materials, and feelings. But who has time for that when you'll get all those sweet-sweet upgrades for this shiny new katana you found in a forest by wiping out those "friendly" robot villages.
If you're persistent on just getting the one main ending, it'll take 7 hours, for two endings, double that to 14. Yes there are main endings and side endings. From depressing, to maniacal, to comic-relief. But the main endings are the real kicker here and if you're staying for all of them then boy you're in for a real treat with some of them taking days without a guide. Side and Main endings.
TL;DR
Environments will change as time goes on, there will be points of no return, there will be lots of weapons to collect, bots to kill, bosses to conquer, music like no other to enjoy, character development, prominent RPG elements such as: levelling, upgrades, customizable skillsets through the grindy chips system, and best of all, fishing. No need to expand upon that, just fish wherever, and whenever you can. Even the tarpits that wiped out The Croods in their true ending.
Kind of a b*tch to mod with repeat playthroughs, considering that there are mod authors acting like a literal YandereDev but you know, anything to get the game running [S]moother.
10/10 the footjob scene was well [E]dited

184413765.review:
NieR: Automata — це справжній шедевр, який поєднує в собі емоційну історію, глибоку філософію та захопливий ігровий процес. Гра пропонує щось більше, ніж просто битви з роботами — це розповідь про боротьбу, самопізнання та пошук сенсу життя.

Ігровий процес
Це не просто слешер! NieR: Automata змінює жанри на ходу: шутер, платформер, RPG — і все це плавно поєднується. Битви динамічні, із великою кількістю комбо, різноманітною зброєю та неймовірно стильними анімаціями. А дослідження відкритого світу з його похмурими, але прекрасними локаціями перетворюється на справжню пригоду.

Музика
Саундтрек заслуговує окремих оплесків. Музика від Keiichi Okabe створює ідеальну атмосферу, передаючи напруження битв і глибину емоцій персонажів. Кожен трек — це витвір мистецтва.

Візуальна складова
Дизайн світу порожнюватий але багато персонажів в сайд квестах добре прописані. Постапокаліптичний світ виглядає одночасно похмурим і неймовірно красивим. Анімації бойових рухів та атмосфера гри занурюють у світ NieR з головою.

Мінуси
Не якісно портована на ПК треба самому ламати голову з мувментом та потрібно витратити багато часу на її проходження бо кінцівки А та B це тільки початок сюжету.

NieR: Automata — це гра, яку не можна пропустити, якщо ви цінуєте сильний сюжет, прекрасну музику та різноманітний ігровий процес. Вона змусить вас сміятися, сумувати, боротися та розмірковувати над сенсом буття.

Оцінка: 9 з 10 дупок 2B.

184381882.review:
I've never played a game in this series before. It gets a lot of hype and I figured it was time to check it out.

It's a great game-- really really fun gameplay, epic story, massive scale, massive bosses, beautiful music, and it's pretty lengthy. 

It's not without its flaws, it's definitely not a PERFECT game. They don't make the characters move their mouths for example when speaking, and there are text dialogues that you have to read, not all are voiced. There are some areas you cannot get to etc etc, there are flaws, but dang, I can overlook those small gripes because this is pretty unique and awesome. 

I didn't know you could mix so many genres together and still have something people enjoy. It blends like 10 different genres into one epic action game. 

I'm a sucker for 2.5 d games, and this one goes between full 3d world, then 2.5 d platforming pretty often. There are also moments where it goes into a top down style-twin stick shooter type game, and then there are also moments it goes into an isometric view. 

The presentation is very good. You're jumping between all these different styles pretty often, and it's honestly very well executed. As a longtime gamer who plays a lot of different stuff, I feel accomplished when the game throws something new at me that I overcome.

There are also some bullet hell type sections as well, both with the player on foot, and the player in a ship. Yup, you're flying some too. And you're dodging, while fighting and shooting. There is a big, semi open world as well, and a lot of collecting and crafting and leveling as you would see in an RPG. 

There is sword fighting, a good amount of weapons with upgrades and unique combos for each of them, and at the same time, you have a drone of sorts that you almost always rapid fire at enemies with. It's a 3d bullet hell on foot at times. It lends itself to an endless amount of play styles. It's really unique, and really well done.

Barring some kind of twist that I come to hate, I have to give it to them and leave this review giving it massive praise. This game is truly one of a kind, and it deserves all the recognition it gets. It explores a lot of interesting philosophical themes such as The Ship of Theseus and plent more. It has a story and subject matter with interesting characters you can think about outside of play. 

There are some themes that border on "woke" but totally not in a bad way--it's not all preachy and crying out for attention, the gameplay speaks for itself and the characters are interesting, definitely not shoehorned in lazily to push ideology. This is how you explore these themes correctly without alienating the player base!!! Write interesting characters that aren't completely interchangeable, deliver themes that make the players think, then let the gameplay and story speak for themselves.   

There is zero cringe in this game. The game is pretty freaking awesome. I'm excited to keep on pushing through to the end. They don't make them like this anymore. I would trade out realistic animations and graphics for this kind of style and presentation any day of the week. 

Take me back! This is how video games are supposed to feel. 2B is badass, and I forgot to mention, yes you're playing as an attractive lady character in a thong, but you basically forget all about dat ass because the game is so fun and unique. If someone called this a gooner game, man, they couldn't be further from reality in that assessment. This is truly a work of art.

Good stuff. I'll most definitely try playing the sequel after I'm done with this one.

Final note, the graphics aren't overly intense, but the game looks very good. I appreciate that, it likely runs well on a lot of different setups and you definitely don't need the latest and greatest gear to enjoy this one. I might call it a masterpiece once I've finished, but I will hold that back until then. 

I really like what I've seen so far!!! I'm pretty hooked.

184381131.review:
Nier: Automata is an absolute masterpiece, offering a gaming experience that transcends traditional storytelling and gameplay expectations. From the moment you begin, it’s evident that this is more than just an action RPG—it’s a deep, thought-provoking journey that challenges your perceptions of humanity, morality, and purpose.

The story is nothing short of incredible. Set in a post-apocalyptic world where androids battle alien-created machines for survival, the narrative weaves a complex and layered tale that constantly surprises you. It explores profound themes like existentialism, identity, and the meaning of life, often leaving you questioning the very nature of the characters you control. The multi-perspective storytelling, enhanced by its unconventional structure requiring multiple playthroughs, ensures that every layer of the story feels meaningful and impactful.

Character development is another highlight. 2B, 9S, and A2 are far from your typical video game protagonists. Each has a unique personality and set of motivations, and their relationships evolve in deeply emotional and, at times, heartbreaking ways. The game excels at making you care about these characters, rooting for them, and mourning their losses. The moral ambiguity of their actions adds depth, making them feel truly human despite their android nature.

Gameplay mechanics are equally stellar, combining fluid hack-and-slash combat with bullet-hell elements, open-world exploration, and even side-scrolling segments. The seamless transitions between these styles keep the gameplay fresh and engaging throughout. PlatinumGames’ signature combat system shines here, offering precision and style while remaining accessible.

What sets Nier: Automata apart is its willingness to tackle controversial and thought-provoking themes. It boldly questions the value of existence, explores the consequences of blind obedience, and delves into the emotional toll of eternal conflict. These themes are woven into the gameplay, dialogue, and even the endings, making the experience feel cohesive and unforgettable.

Overall, Nier: Automata is a brilliant fusion of narrative depth, character-driven storytelling, and innovative gameplay. It’s a game that lingers in your mind long after the credits roll, challenging you to reflect on its messages. Whether you’re a fan of action, RPGs, or games that push the boundaries of storytelling, Nier: Automata is a must-play.

184380604.review:
There's nothing left for me to say that hasn't been said already. The game is incredible and if you have the time to really sit down and enjoy it you will not be disappointed. One of my favorite sound tracks across all games. Characters and story telling is incredibly in-depth. One of the most emotional and thought-provoking gaming experiences I’ve ever had. At first, it seemed like a stylish hack-and-slash RPG with an intriguing sci-fi story, but as I progressed, I realized just how deep and layered the narrative truly was. The game constantly surprised me with its twists, shifting perspectives, and philosophical themes about identity, free will, and what it means to exist. Each playthrough added new dimensions to the story, and by the end, I was left emotionally drained in the best way possible.

The combat was fluid and fun—combining flashy combos, smooth dodging, and a touch of bullet-hell chaos. While it wasn’t the deepest combat system I’ve played, it was engaging enough to keep me hooked, and it blended perfectly with the game’s dynamic pacing. The hauntingly beautiful soundtrack stuck with me long after I put the controller down, and the ruined world was as breathtaking as it was melancholic. That said, the open-world sections sometimes felt a bit empty, and the side quests, while occasionally meaningful, were often repetitive and tedious. Having to replay sections of the game for the full story was a bit frustrating at first, but by the time I understood what the game was doing, I appreciated it.

Nier: Automata is the kind of game that stays with you long after you finish it. It’s not perfect—there were moments of monotony, and the combat could feel a bit simplistic—but the narrative, music, and emotional weight more than made up for it. It’s an experience I’d recommend to anyone who loves games that make you think, feel, and question everything.

The mouse can move your camera, sure, but none of the mouse buttons do anything. The game has a keybind editor, so all is good, right...? 184298604.review:
[h1] While it took me over 7 years and three separate attempts, I finally managed to play through NieR:Automata, and I'm glad I did. [/h1]

Simply put, this is a very special game and one I recommend anyone experience at least once. The story is unique, touching, thought-provoking and frankly just very interesting, especially if you like philosophical themes. It's not necessary to play other NieR games before this one, though it may give additional context to *why* things are happening.

The story alone is enough to earn my recommendation, but I'll touch on the gameplay a little. This is an action title with decent combat and responsive controls, but the overall mechanics don't feel all that complex. From start to finish you can basically use the same fighting strategies throughout: constantly shoot, spam dodge and melee. The enemy variety isn't too large and none require any particular strategic adjustment to defeat. NieR:Automata does offer some RPG-like character customization (brilliantly thematically incorporated as combat chips) alongside several weapons, but there's no serious need to engage with it too deeply, at least on normal difficulty.

This, combined with the quirk of NieR:Automata having you play through a significant portion of the game twice, is why it took me three attempts to finish. The action loop wasn't always enough to keep me engaged through the game's slower sections. But man, the ending really makes up for it, you just have to get there.

I also want to give a special shout out to the side quests. While they mostly boil down to "go here", "kill this", or "collect this", the mini stories they tell are weirdly captivating and definitely add to the overall narrative.

I highly recommend using a controller for this one: I had no issues with mine (Xbox) and I can't imagine playing with KB+M.

So yeah, pick this one up! It frequently goes on sale and is well worth $15-20.

Nier: Automata ist ein beeindruckendes Spiel. Besonders fazinierden sind die fesselnde Soundtrack von Keiichi Okabe, der die emotionale Tiefe der Umgebung perfekt untermalt. Die Musik bleibt im Gedächtnis und verstärkt die Atmosphäre in jeder Spielsituation.
Das Gameplay kombiniert JRPG-Elemente mit Arcade-Action, was für ein dynamisches und abwechslungsreiches Spielerlebnis sorgt. Die Kämpfe sind flüssig und die nahtlosen Übergänge zwischen den verschiedenen Spielstilen sind ein tolles Element.
Nier: Automata sollte man unbedingt mehrfach Durchspielen, um die gesamte Geschichte zu verstehen. Jeder Spieldurchlauf bietet neue Perspektiven und tiefere Einblicke in die Charaktere und die Handlung, was das Spiel zu einem echten Erlebnis macht. Das Sammeln wird mit mehr Geschichte belohnt und man versinkt richtig in Das Nier Universum, durch die ganzen Querverweise.
Nier: Automata ist ein besonderes Game was emotional berührt und die Frage nach Leben wieder einmal stellt.

184272991.review:
How was I ever supposed to know a game featuring a protagonist wearing a mini skirt would tell such an emotional, deep, and tragic story? Let's be honest, I already knew about it before picking up the game, but you get the point. Nier Automata tells an incredibly emotional, touching story deeply rooted in the philosophies of Pascal's wager and Nietzsche (or so I understood, I stand to be corrected if I'm wrong) featuring some of the most heartbreaking, tragically beautiful moments I've ever witnessed in a game, not to mention the incredibly touching final ending - no comment on that though, this is something you simply have to experience for yourself.

Besides the story the soundtrack also deserves to be praised, always creating the mood it seeks to evoke, be it getting you pumped up or tearing your heart straight of your chest. The combat's a lot of fun too, just as you'd expect from Platinum. My only gripe with the game are the side quests, which sadly almost always boil down to being simple fetch quests, but the dialogue and lore they provide do luckily compensate, so I didn't really mind spending a few solid hours doing fetch quests which I'd believe to be incredibly stupid in many other games. 

Due to the side quests I'd give Nier Automata a 9/10, but thanks to the game just being so unique, so touching, and so very special I think it deserves the 10/10 label. If you enjoy action games and deep, touching stories, go experience this game - it's an one of a kind, and you'd miss out heavily if you passed on it.

184173349.review:
É um jogo bastante divertido. Na minha primeira play passar 7 horas sem perceber é algo notável.

Seu sistema hibrido de Hack/Slash e RPG é muito bem desenvolvido e bastante único. Algo que realmente vale a pena.

Seu sistema de habilidades é confuso no começo mas dá para entender com tempo e atenção.

Creio que seus pontos mais fracos seja: Sistema de mapas, que é bastante confuso, as quests não são bem marcadas como no Final Fantasy tendo horas que você pode se perder no mapa aberto, questão de otimização do jogo também é um calcanhar de aquiles, vendo que meu PC que cobre os requisitos recomendados (e até passa em alguns pontos) em certos momentos vejo que há dificuldades para rodar, sendo que ví muitos drop-frames e jogatina sub-60FPS isso no médio/low.

Quem puder comprar, compre. É um bom jogo. Mas atente ao fato que sua máquina tem que estar bem acima das specs recomendadas do jogo caso queira uma experiência realmente boa.

184148647.review:
Na początku nie byłam pewna, czy mam dać tej grze szansę. Wyglądała jak 1745-ta odmiana typowego JRPG, tyle że z perspektywy trzeciej osoby. Jednak z każdą godziną spędzoną w świecie Nier Automata moje pierwsze wrażenie zmieniało się diametralnie.

Fabuła okazała się zaskakująca i niezwykle wciągająca. Porusza wiele głębokich zagadnień filozoficznych, takich jak sens istnienia, moralność maszyn czy granice człowieczeństwa. Co więcej, te tematy są wplecione w historię w sposób tak naturalny, że trudno oderwać się od myślenia o nich nawet długo po zakończeniu gry.

Pod względem wizualnym gra prezentuje się bardzo dobrze. Choć grafika nie jest rewolucyjna, jest wystarczająco porządna, by budować odpowiednią atmosferę świata po apokalipsie. Prawdziwym klejnotem jest jednak muzyka – klimatyczna, emocjonalna i doskonale dopasowana do każdej sytuacji.

Gra oferuje aż 16 zakończeń, w tym 5 głównych (A-E). Polecam szczególnie dążyć do osiągnięcia zakończenia E, które można uznać za prawdziwe zakończenie historii. Jest ono nie tylko satysfakcjonujące, ale też pełne emocji i symboliki, która pozostaje w pamięci na długo.

Nier Automata to zdecydowanie więcej niż kolejny JRPG. To gra, która łączy dynamiczną rozgrywkę, intrygującą fabułę i głębokie przesłanie, oferując jednocześnie doświadczenie, które zapada w pamięć.

„Chwała ludzkości!”

184092712.review:
Среди множества игр лишь единицы способны сломать устоявшиеся шаблоны так, как эта. Йоко Таро вновь доказывает, что игры — это настоящее искусство, способное пробуждать глубокие эмоции и заставлять задуматься. Эта игра разрывает рамки привычного буквально во всем: сюжет, который держит в напряжении до последнего, и с каждым часом становится мрачнее; мини-игры, кажущиеся на первый взгляд случайными, но обретая смысл в контексте; концовки, которые переворачивают восприятие; и даже титры, в которых вас ждет невероятный финальный бой.

Где еще вы будете сражаться с титрами? Какая другая игра расскажет самую трогательную историю о людях — без участия людей? Этот шедевр поднимает такие вопросы, на которые каждый найдет свои ответы, и при этом оставляет неизгладимое впечатление.

Это не просто игра — это произведение искусства, которое заслуживает звания триумфа современной игровой индустрии. Здесь есть все: смелость, инновации, эмоции и глубина. Обязательно пройдите ее, чтобы пережить этот уникальный опыт. Рекомендую всем, кто ищет что-то большее, чем просто развлечение.

184079458.review:
I'd make this a mixed review if I could, but it's definitely worth the twenty bucks I paid for it as of 2024. This review will contain no mention of story, but concerns gameplay elements that are accessible within the first hour or two of play.

- The balance of this game is pretty terrible, pretty much exclusively tied to your relative level with the enemy. Adjust your difficulty if you feel it growing too hard or too easy, as enemies can either be untouchable and kill you in 1-2 hits or a single lucky drop or a spike in levels can render entire sections of the game trivial.
- The primary way to actively progress powerwise in this game aside from level requires save/load grinding on the scale of many hours for a single given upgrade in its highest tier (say, +100% max health), or rare drops requiring you to reload an area 15-30 times upwards to get enough materials to upgrade a given thing. Don't ever bother with this unless you are just happy to do it, and if so, look up a guide on how to do it properly.

Pros:
Solid core gameplay, good music

184010441.review:
Не знаю зачем я написал свой отзыв о Ниер, но пусть будет. Месяц назад я наконец-то добрался по Nier Automata и поиграл в неё. Цель была одна - понять почему же её многие так нахваливают и называют шедевром. Спойлер: не зашло

1) Геймплей. Вначале было интересно исследовать мир, но когда я понял, что по факту бегал по пустой карте, где были разбросаны болванчики, я начал душится и стараться быстрее пройти от точки А до Б. Битвы оценю как +/-. Как бы ок, но сражения в тот же МГР от платинумов или DMC от капком мне нравились своей динамикой куда больше + мешал саунд (об этом позже)

2) Сюжет. Пройдя игру почти 3 раза (задушился и удалил игру на этапе с башнями перед финалом) и допройдя на Ютубе, я понял, что можно было её проходить чисто на Ютубе. Никому из персонажей я симпатии особо так и не разделил. Разве что А2. 

3) Саундтрек. Скажу просто: вот эти спокойные меланхоличные саунды, играющие на протяжении всей локации и не сменяющиеся в драках - ну не моё. Ни в Стеллар Блейд, ли в Ниер я не проникся этим. Я хочу, чтобы меня саундтрек в слешерах должен был мотивировать бить врагов мощно и со стилем, быстро и точно. Музыка должна быть драйвовой что-ли. А если брать саунд чисто из Ниер, то запомнился и понравился лишь один саунд - тот, что играет на локации парка развлечений

Возможно, для меня Ниер остался в памяти как что-то серое и неинтересное, потому что я ожидал чего-то шедеврального и гениального, но не получил. Думал, что раз это слешер, то играться будет также весело, как в МГР, но нет. Да и перед тем, как начать в неё играть, я прошёл Якузду 0, от которой я остался в восторге. В общем, как-то так

И вот наконец скачав её просто не мог оторваться, без преувеличения одна из лучших игр, которую я проходил в своей жизни. Очень понравился сюжет и сам сеттинг, а саундтрек вообще ****** просто нету слов, каждый трек прекрасен, он меняется от локации к локации передавая её настроение, порой хотелось просто стоять и слушать. Очень понравилось как разработчики реализовали различные концовки (в целом расписывать про это не буду сами всё увидите когда её пройдете в первый раз). Даже некоторые побочные квесты смогли удивить, обычно в играх с открытым миром побочные квесты довольно скучные, если я их и проходил, то не все и только для галочки, тут же всё в точности наоборот, было довольно много побочек с интересными историями, благодаря которым можно было лучше разобраться в сюжете. Единственные 2 минуса, которые я заметил это: местами мыльные текстуры и плохая дальность прорисовки хотя играл на ультрах, но лично для меня эти минусы незначительны. Однозначно ставлю игре 10/10 и в будущем буду обязательно проходить Nier Replicant.

183979644.review: Проиграл в игру около 15 часов и могу с уверенностью сказать, что игра понравится любителям слэшеров, наподобие, Bayonetta, DMC подобных игр, так же любителям игр от чистого "японского геймдева"- так вот NieR: Automata - это тот самый гроаль . Конечно игра не без своих минусов, а это 1) Специфичная система сохранения в игре, 2) Не совсем продуманная система, использования предметов (это аля аптечки и разные бусты для персонажа), особенно это заметно, во время боя, 3) Неудобная карта мира. Понять как пройти к месту, чтобы выполнить тот или иной квест, порой вызывает затруднения. 4) Возможно это даже не минус, а так минус с натяжкой - это несколько замудренная система прокачки персонажа, путем конфигурации сетов т.е хочешь, чтобы персонаж был, более сильным в бою, ставь такие чипы, чтобы другим в поведении такие...в общем не совсем практично на мой взгляд, ну это мое мнение. 5) Даже не совсем минус, а скорее наблюдение - это наполненность мира. Мир игры кажется пустым.

183921745.review:
The gameplay can be a bit repetitive at times and the hacking minigame is [b]terrible[/b], but the lovely soundtrack and the alluring beauty of the city ruins will enchant you immediately. I have mixed feelings about the story because I kinda completed the game over the course of 7 years and the way I interact with stories has changed quite a lot over that time.  However, there are some story beats here that show me why I still love games and Nier:Automata uses the medium to a degree I have never seen before. There's a certain scene with 9s that makes my heart ache and it doesn't want to leave my head. I wish everyone could experience the full Nier:Automata experience but I feel like it's padded too much. To be frank, there are simply too many quests that feel like busywork, and halfway through the game the gameplay regresses a bit which is where I dropped the game years ago. I think if the game was a little bit more focused, a lot more people could have seen how truly amazing this game can be.

You should play with a controller - I played with KB&M and gamepad, and the difference is night and day - and don't forget to pet your pod every once in a while.

183897263.review:
尼尔融合了很多哲学思想，比如存在主义还有在此基础上延伸的虚无主义。
[spoiler]故事几乎从最开始就预兆了整个故事是悲剧形式，但即使如此我们与2b 9s A2与寄叶部队甚至是机械生命体们也都固执地跟宿命做着对争。
机械生命体诞生的意义是为了消灭人造人，但在此基础上他们却衍生出了感情还摧毁了造物主。
寄叶部队诞生的意义是对抗机械生命体，并最终被计划全灭。但他们也逐渐拥有了人类的情感，而预兆的团灭结局，也被pod和我们所改写，最终让主角团活了下来。
你可以认为我们所做的一切毫无意义，但是你也不可否认我们确实改写了历史。[/spoiler]在这个人类文明崩坏的时代，一群无血无肉的机械却继承了人类的文明和情感，正如那句贯彻全剧的誓言‘‘愿人类荣光永存’’，纵使形体泯灭，也愿人类情感之光永存。

183838865.review:
Simplesmente um dos melhores jogos que tive o prazer de experienciar toda a sua beleza!!

Lembro que comecei jogando pela "versão 0800" e estava um pouco que sem animo por saber que precisava terminar o jogo nas rotas A,B,C,D e E para ter o jogo por completo, pois estava pensando que se tratava de refazer tudo novamente, mas apos começar a rota B as coisas começaram a fazer um sentido maior para mim e não tive escolha, comprei logo (aproveitando a promo) usei o meu save da versão jack sparrow (essa parte foi complicada de conseguir fazer funcionar) que já estava lá nas suas 30hrs, e depois de terminar por completo todos os seus "capítulos" posso dizer que esse jogo e o meu preferido em anos!

A sua narrativa e forma de contar sua trama foi que me fisgou por completo, principalmente por se tratar de existencialismo e em partes um certo niilismo que em um certo momento me causou uma sensação muito forte de angustia, mas também de acolhimento, não tenho muito o que comentar sobre o game não pois estaria entregando boa parte de sua experiencia fantastica, que sinceramente nunca sentir em outro jogo da mesma forma, guardarei com carinho essa obra de arte como uma das melhores experiências da minha vida!



AGORA E JUNTAR GRANINHA PRO NIER REPLICANT!!!

183772079.review: "A future is not something given to you. It is something you must take for yourself." After playing Replicant and now Automata, I understand why the series gets such high praise. Through all the routes you can take, all the decisions you can make, and the multiple endings the game offers, none of these paths feel rushed at all. There are so many characters that feel fleshed out and full of life even though the world itself is full of despair. The music, scenery, and dialogue is all stuff I am very fond it as it conveys so much emotion and you can tell how much time was put into it from the staff. It is genuinely one of the best games I have played to this day and I highly recommend it to anyone who enjoys longer story RPG games.

183708377.review:
NieR:Automata es una experiencia única y profunda que no deja indiferente.
Desde el primer momento, el juego nos sumerge en un mundo devastado, lleno de preguntas existenciales y temas profundamente serios que exploran la naturaleza de la humanidad, el significado de la vida y el dolor de la pérdida.

Los personajes son, sin lugar a dudas, uno de los puntos más fuertes del juego. 2B, 9S, A2... tienen una carga emocional enorme y un pasado que quieres descubrir a toda costa. Cada uno de ellos tiene una razón de ser, y su desarrollo no solo es coherente, sino que logra que te encariñes con ellos, incluso en sus momentos más duros.

En cuanto a gráficos, no son lo más espectacular que verás, pero cumplen perfectamente su función. Cada escenario tiene el nivel de detalle necesario para sumergirte por completo en su mundo.

La banda sonora, por otro lado, es simplemente magistral. Cada área del juego está acompañada por temas que parecen haber sido compuestos específicamente para transmitir las emociones del momento. Las canciones vocales, instrumentales o más lentas encajan a la perfección, y cada pieza te envuelve en la atmósfera de este mundo desolado pero lleno de belleza. Es de esos casos en los que la música no solo acompaña, sino que eleva cada escena a un nivel superior.

Eso sí, hay que mencionar que la historia puede sentirse algo repetitiva hasta que llegas al segundo final. A partir de ahí, las cosas toman un giro espectacular y todo cobra mucho más sentido.

NieR:Automata es un juego que no se limita a ser divertido; es una obra que te hará cuestionar, sentir y pensar.

183611534.review:
The most overrated game I have played in a long time. I waited to buy it on sale, and I am so grateful that I did. This game is objectively TERRIBLE. The fans and critics will praise it for it's "art" but honestly, they are massively overselling it.

There are so many problems with this game that this review could easily be five pages long. I will try to be brief. First of all, the MAJORITY of the game is spent in combat. There are machines/robots everywhere you go, and you will have to engage with them. Furthermore, there are VERY light RPG elements, so to level your character, you will need to defeat enemies. The problem is the combat is AWFUL. It is repetitive and boring. There are only about for combo strings that you can do. All of the weapons in each category (small swords, large swords, spears, and fists) have the exact same moveset, so changing weapons doesn't change your combat much at all. This game is the definition of "button masher." You will be hitting light-light-light-heavy-heavy-dodge-repeat for the entire game. Yes, there are a few different moves, and some stats to your weapons, but they are all meaningless, because they don't have any impact on how the game is played or how enemies are defeated. To make matters worse, the enemies are all identical as well. There are something like a grand total of 10 different enemy types, and they just swap out their design a bit when you discover new areas. You will literally fight HUNDREDS of small trash-can shaped robots, but one will be wearing a mask, one will be wearing a jester hat, and one will have a drill on his chest, but all the same enemies, with the SAME attack patterns! I have seen some fanboys say that this game is supposed to be a "bullet hell" game, but that's utter nonsense. Whenever you encounter enemies, there are always like four melee enemies and maybe two shooting enemies. The vast majority of encounters don't have any shooting enemies at all (or if they do, they only shoot when you are out of melee range). The majority of boss encounters are also melee focused, and only have brief shooting sections. The most charitable thing I can say is that N:A is hybrid hack-n-slash and bullet hell game, but it is completely pathetic at both!

The very first thing every breathless fan of this game will tell you is "but the STORY is so DEEP and PHILOSOPHICAL." The thing is, this just isn't true. I think the people who loved the story/philosophy of this game either have nostalgia goggles from playing previous Nier games, or are under 18 years old and haven't played a lot of games. I am going to date myself here, but I played the first Bioshock when it came out. Here is a list of games I have played in my life, off the top of my head, that have deep philosophical ideas and are ALSO actually FUN to play: System Shock 1 & 2, Bioshock, Deus Ex (original), Deus Ex Human Revolution, Dark Souls (take your pick), Hollow Knight, Prey, Batman Arkham Asylum, Tales of Berseria (MOST of the "Tales" games actually), The Witcher 3, and I think I should stop listing because I'm just getting more angry that this stupid game wasted my time. There isn't a single "twist" or "reveal" in N:A that I didn't see coming. The philosophy is shallow and transparent from the very beginning of the game and never gets any deeper.

The other part that people will try to defend is the characters. Again, anyone who has watched anime for a few years will instantly recognize the unimaginative cookie-cutter character tropes. 2B is the classic "kuudere" character who acts aloof and uncaring, but deep down harbors passionate feelings. 9S is the "ototo" or little brother, who is strangely cute for a boy and can't hide his feelings for the older sister character. But N:A doesn't do anything unique with these tropes. The characters just play them straight the entire way through. It's like watching Naruto, but there isn't any major dramatic plot points or character arcs. The characters are static and repetitive, just like the combat. Again, I could only see a teenager who's first introduction to anime was Naruto and then this game finding these characters compelling, but I have watch many GREAT anime shows, and the characters in this game just make me cringe and roll my eyes.

Other problems that I don't have the time to write extended explanations for:
- The RPG elements like upgrading weapons, upgrading pods, installing program chips, are all complicated, but ultimately pointless
- Putting the game on Hard difficulty is idiotic, and expects perfection. Every single boss has a 1-hit kill attack, and any other attacks will 2-hit you. I have played EVERY Fromsoft game since Dark Souls 1, and have beaten them all solo, and the difficulty spike from Normal to Hard is just stupid. On normal, you can just spam your way through the game, barely even attempting to dodge enemies. You can take 5+ hits from most bosses without healing.
-The save system is terrible, and requires you to MANUALLY save at certain checkpoints and then when you die, have to trek back to your body to get all your upgrades (gear) back, with sometimes up to 30 minutes of fighting enemies from the save point (but again WITHOUT your upgraded gear!).
-Here are all the settings in the game: crumbling city, desert crumbling city, flooded crumbling city, amusement park (in the city), factory, forest/castle, and TINY gray space-station. As you can see, a crumbling city is basically all of them (factory is included in this categorization). The most interesting environment is the amusement park, and you spend all of 30 minutes there and only return for terrible fetch quests.
- Speaking of quests, the majority of side quests are terrible and uninteresting. All the ones you know and hate are here: the escort mission, the fetch quest, and the go to a location and fight these guys.
- The game randomly changes screen positions to be top-down or side-scrolling for really no reason. It doesn't improve the gameplay at all
- Most boss fights are boring and simplistic.
- The game wastes your time. You have to replay the main story through a 2nd time as your partner 9s and it's SOOOO BORING. The 3rd playthrough is better, but not much (couldn't even finish it, I was so sick of the game).
Okay, okay. I'm done ranting. Don't pick up this game unless you are looking for a slightly more involved walking simulator.

183579479.review:
[h1]NieR:Automata [/h1]
[hr][/hr]
[i]Гарна дупця, а де гра? [/i]
[hr][/hr]
[h2]Сюжет:[/h2] дуже цікавий, напевно міг би бути, але вийшла затягнута [b]нудьга[/b]. І це [u]основна причина[/u], по якій я перестав грати після [b]7 годин гри.[/b] 

[h2]Геймплей:[/h2] цікавий підхід до [b]бойового аспекту[/b] в такій грі, адже [u]спеціальні прийоми[/u] відсутні - які небудь [u]навчальні процеси[/u] теж. Гру починаєш як літак, а отже плюс-мінус основний [b]"мув-сет"[/b] проходиш на ньому. Діло доходить до [b]головного персонажа[/b] і тут вже чорт ногу зламає. Якісь [b]чипи[/b], якісь [b]апгрейди[/b] - граючи [u]7 годин[/u], я та і не дійшов до моменту де приїжджає [b]пояснювальна бригада[/b]. [b]Дисбаланс складності[/b] гри і адекватного комбінування атак приводить до того, що на [b]складнішому рівні[/b] гри - [b]ТИ[/b] [u]бігаєш колами[/u], намагаючись не вмерти, а в цей час твій [b]ДРОН[/b] [i](супутник з дальніми атаками)[/i] [u]наносить шкоду[/u]. 

[h2]Візуальний стиль і графіка:[/h2] [b]ДУПЦЯ[/b], а все інше то [b]дрібниці[/b].

[h2]Звук і музика:[/h2] музичний супровід бійок хороший, добре підкреслює активність подій. Щодо [b]діалогів[/b] - звуковий ряд іноді зникає і присутній тільки текст, а в більшості діалогів побічних місій, взагалі [u]відсутній[/u] звуковий ряд.

[h2]Реплейабельність і тривалість:[/h2] мене вистачило на [u]7 годин[/u] [b]нудної біганини[/b], скільки займає ця гра на повне проходження не знаю і знати не хочу. Чи матиму я бажання в неї знову колись грати? Відповідь очевидна - [b]НІ[/b].

[h2]Позитивні сторони:[/h2] 
• [b]ДУПЦЯ[/b]

[h2]Недоліки:[/h2] 
[b]• незручна взаємодія з картою та мінікартою
• неадекватність ігрової складності 
• дуже дивна система збереження гри
• брак навчання і пояснення більшості ігрових механік
• наростаюча нудьга 
• "загубленість" екрану під час бою 
• неадекватна ескалація шкоди\здоров'я ворогів
• однотипність бойової системи головного персонажа
• набридливий "бевзь" в шортах, який постійно бігає за нами[/b]
[hr][/hr]
[i]Чомусь після прочитання відгуків, думав гра буде втягуюча. Але вже на самому початку, коли довелось [u]4 рази[/u] дивитись вступні титри і літати літачком (бо почав на складному рівні), зрозумів що щось не так. Гра вийшла затягнута, а не затягуюча. Особисто для мене, [b]ВЕЛИКЕ[/b] розчарування. [/i]

[b]Моя особиста оцінка: 2/10[/b]

[h1]优缺点并存的两极化体验——[/h1]
相信每一位喜欢JRPG的玩家都或多或少的听说过《尼尔：机械纪元》（以下简称“本作”）。自2017年发布以来，本作凭借其独特深邃的世界观、深刻的哲学思考、精美的音乐和创新的叙事方式，吸引了大量玩家，但也因其游戏性、剧情设计以及一些细节上的问题，受到一定的质疑。正如许多带有强烈个人风格的作品一样，本作不仅在玩家群体中产生了两极分化的评价，连笔者自身恐怕也难以作出统一的判断。本文将全面分析这款游戏的优缺点，尝试给出一个尽可能客观的评价。
[h1]一场存在主义的危机（剧透警告）——[/h1]
[spoiler]本作的剧情可以说是这款游戏最为出彩的部分。其叙事方式借鉴了“多周目”与“超展开”的结构，通过不同的视角逐步揭示真相，尤其在情感的描写上非常细腻。最初，游戏将大量篇幅用于塑造主角2B和9S之间的关系，而这种简单的框架随着剧情的发展逐渐变得复杂。游戏通过对话和细节的安排，展示了这对人造人之间微妙的情感纠葛。比如，9S在战斗中的过度表现与2B的冷漠外表形成鲜明对比，这些看似简单的对话和动作背后隐藏着极大的情感张力。[/spoiler]
[h1]虚妄的未来何去何从（剧透警告）——[/h1]
[spoiler]从一周目到三周目，游戏巧妙地通过重复的视角转换，揭示敌对方的背景和动机，让每个角色不仅仅是战斗的工具，而是有着自己故事和目标的个体。特别是在三周目，随着故事逐渐走向高潮，角色的情感爆发变得尤为强烈，特别是9S面对2B复制体的反应，令人印象深刻。这种情感的铺垫和爆发，配合音乐和演出的精致设计，让玩家在沉浸其中的同时，也感受到了角色们在失落与绝望中的挣扎。[/spoiler]
[h1]凄美的角色故事（剧透警告）——[/h1]
[spoiler]本作中的角色之间的关系充满了对比和冲突，尤其是2B与9S的关系。虽然游戏一开始看似是一对典型的战斗伙伴，但随着剧情的推进，玩家会发现他们之间的情感变化极为微妙。游戏中的对话非常精致，很多看似简单的对话实际上都蕴藏着伏笔。例如，在序章中，当9S提出“为什么2B会负责调查”时，2B的回答“不要抱怨命令”看似是个简单的回应，但从四周目再看时，这段对话充满了感伤的意味，仿佛是暗示了他们之间并不简单的情感。此外，游戏还通过多个视角展示敌人的背景，尤其是Boss的描写相当精彩。比如森林王国的故事以及歌姬Boss的背景，不仅使敌人更加立体，同时也让玩家在战斗中感受到更多的情感冲击。这种细致的描写让玩家在每一场战斗中不仅仅是与敌人作战，更是在与他们的故事和命运进行对话。[/spoiler]
[h1]音乐成为游戏的灵魂——[/h1]
本作中的音乐无疑是最为出色的部分之一。游戏中的BGM无论是旋律还是编曲，都深深地打动了玩家的心。特别是在二周目，游戏的音乐几乎成为了玩家在跑图过程中的唯一动力。《Weight of the World》这首歌，尽管在游戏中听了多次，但在三周目的结尾处，它的出现依然能够让人感动至深，许多玩家甚至因其再次泪目。每一首歌曲都带有深刻的情感表达，尤其在剧情高潮时的配乐，能够极大地增强玩家的沉浸感。
[h1]叙事和氛围设计（剧透警告）——[/h1]
[spoiler]游戏的演出效果也非常到位，尤其是在boss战和重要剧情节点。比如在游乐园的场景中，夕阳的配色和小安卓们的欢乐气氛相辅相成，再加上《游园设施》这首悲伤的旋律，让人深刻感受到游戏世界的荒诞与凄美。而在与歌姬Boss的对决中，出场的瞬间就伴随着强烈的音效和视觉效果，直接让玩家感受到压迫感。整个boss战的氛围设计十分出色，尤其是在配乐的衬托下，战斗的紧张感被放大了好几倍。在三周目2B的死、9S的情感爆发等重要场景中，镜头的推移和切换赋予了这些场景更多的电影感，使得玩家在体验剧情时更加沉浸。[/spoiler]
[h1]游戏性与设计上的妥协——[/h1]
尽管本作在剧情安排和音乐上表现出色，但其游玩内容方面是一个相对较大的短板。本作任务设计上的重复性很高，尤其是需要玩家从A点跑到B点的任务，跑图的体验常常令人感到十分厌烦。游戏并没有提供足够好的寻路系统，导致玩家经常迷路，在多数任务之中，迷失方向几乎是家常便饭。这种缺乏深度的任务设计，使得玩家在进行主线任务时感到很大的疲惫感。
[h1]低质量的开放世界——[/h1]
本作的开放世界设计也非常粗糙，很多地图虽然看似广阔，但实际上缺乏辨识度，空气墙到处都是，整体设计显得非常空旷，缺少互动和探索的乐趣。这种设计让玩家难以沉浸在游戏的世界中，反而频繁的空气墙和缺乏标识的区域让人失去了探索的欲望。
[h1]战斗设计的单一与无趣——[/h1]
游戏中的boss战设计也存在很大的问题。虽然游戏的动作系统非常华丽，2B的剑舞和连招十分精致，但许多boss战却让人觉得单调乏味。尤其是那些等级差异过大的boss，往往没有复杂的招式，甚至有些boss在血量减少后并不会改变攻击模式，导致战斗缺乏挑战性和新鲜感。特别是在二周目和三周目，某些boss战的重复性让玩家产生了极大的厌烦感。这些问题削弱了游戏本应提供的动感和刺激，甚至影响了游戏的叙事效果。游戏的数值系统也非常混乱，越级打boss时，玩家往往会面临极大的难度挑战，而打低级boss时则可能体验到无双式的压倒性胜利，这种游戏性上的失衡，使得本作在玩法深度上大打折扣。
[h1]情感驱动下的双刃剑——[/h1]
本作无疑是一部在剧情上充满了深度与创新的作品，尤其是在情感表达和人物塑造方面，展现了极高的水准。它的音乐、场景、和叙事技巧，都是游戏界的瑰宝。但与此同时，游戏的开放世界设计、任务系统、战斗深度等方面却严重拖累了整体体验，导致这部作品在游戏性上显得过于单薄和重复。对于部分玩家而言，游戏的情感冲击和剧情深度足以弥补这些不足，但对于追求玩法深度的玩家来说，可能会感到失望。
[h1]结语——[/h1]
这是一部充满争议的作品，优缺点相互交织，给人留下深刻印象的同时，也不可避免地带来了挫败感。如果你是剧情至上的玩家，或者对深度的情感体验有强烈需求，那么本作无疑是值得一试的佳作；但如果你注重游戏性和挑战性，可能会觉得它只是一个华丽的壳，内里却空空如也。
[h1]简评——[/h1]
[table equalcells=1]
[tr]
        [th][h2][b][i]优势[/i][/b][/h2][/th]
        [th][h2][b][i]不足[/i][/b][/h2][/th]

Romajidesu's website says that 闘志 or "Tōshi" means Fighting Spirit.

A certain ideal of possessing Fighting Spirit has been a common thread linking hundreds, if not thousands of Japanese games, movies, and television shows across decades.

Defeat is but humanity's oldest, closest teacher... And eventually a dear friend to every master.

And so, like Dark Souls, Death Stranding, and Dragon Ball... If you prove to this game that you have Fighting Spirit and that you won't give up, then this game won't give up on you.
